original: @158b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @158b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: tsar+y'a ko sha g'i ta t'i py'a ni pri tti n'a ma /
analyzed: tsar+y'a ko sha g'i ta t'i py'a ni pri tti n'a ma /
translated: Caryakoshagitatatparyanirnaya-nama.

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: spyod pa'i glu'i mdzod kyi 'grel pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: spyod pa'i glu'i mdzod kyi 'grel pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The Commentary on the Treasury of Songs of Spiritual Experience.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Vajrasattva.

original: dpal ldan bla ma dam pa'i zhal gyi chu skyes ro myangs rab gsal brtse ba'i thugs mnga' ba //
analyzed: dpal ldan bla ma dam pa'i zhal gyi chu skyes ro myangs rab gsal brtse ba'i thugs mnga' ba //
translated: Having tasted the lotus face of the glorious holy guru, whose mind is clear and loving,

original: gnyis med blo ldan dpal ldan rdo rje'i dbang phyug dri med zhal mnga' dad pas phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: gnyis med blo ldan dpal ldan rdo rje'i dbang phyug dri med zhal mnga' dad pas phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: I, the one with a stainless face, the glorious Vajradhara, who possesses a nondual mind, pay homage with faith.

original: dpal ldan l'u yi zhabs sogs grub pa rnams kyis gsungs shing ya mtshan spyod pa'i glu ya tshogs //
analyzed: dpal ldan l'u yi zhabs sogs grub pa rnams kyis gsungs shing ya mtshan spyod pa'i glu ya tshogs //
translated: The collection of songs of the amazing conduct, sung by the siddhas such as the glorious Luipa,

original: lam mchog dri ma med pa'i tshig ni rtogs par bya phyir de yi 'grel pas gsal bar bya //
analyzed: lam mchog dri ma med pa'i tshig ni rtogs par bya phyir de yi 'grel pas gsal bar bya //
translated: I will clarify with a commentary in order to understand the words of the stainless supreme path.

original: lus ljon shing mchog yan lag rnam lnga la //
analyzed: lus ljon shing mchog yan lag rnam lnga la //
translated: In the body, the supreme tree, with its five branches,

original: g-yo ba'i sems la sgra gcan rab tu 'jug / brtan par mdzod cing bde chen yongs kyi tshad //
analyzed: g-yo ba'i sems la sgra gcan rab tu 'jug / brtan par mdzod cing bde chen yongs kyi tshad //
translated: Rahu enters the moving mind, and it is held firmly, the measure of all-encompassing great bliss.

original: l'u yis smras ba bla ma la zhus mkhyen //
analyzed: l'u yis smras ba bla ma la zhus mkhyen //
translated: Lu-yi said, Ask the guru.

original: ma lus ting 'dzin rnams kyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: ma lus ting 'dzin rnams kyis ci zhig bya //
translated: What is the use of all the samadhis?

original: bde ba rtsa nas bton na nges bar 'chi //
analyzed: bde ba rtsa nas bton na nges bar 'chi //
translated: If the channel of bliss is opened, one will certainly die.

original: spongs shig sdeb sbyor byed cing g-yo sgyu'i blo //
analyzed: spongs shig sdeb sbyor byed cing g-yo sgyu'i blo //
translated: Abandon the composition and the deceitful mind.

original: stong nyid phyogs la zhags pas bcing gis kye //
analyzed: stong nyid phyogs la zhags pas bcing gis kye //
translated: Bind with the noose the side of emptiness.

original: l'u yi bdag gi bsam gtan nyid kyis mthong //
analyzed: l'u yi bdag gi bsam gtan nyid kyis mthong //
translated: Lu-yi, I see my own samadhi.

original: zla ba nyi ma gnyis phab steng du sdong //üîΩpa ta ha'i snye ma zhes bya ba'i glu'i gdangs so /
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma gnyis phab steng du sdong // pa ta ha'i snye ma zhes bya ba'i glu'i gdangs so /

original: su bying ba skyabs med la sdug bsngal ba'i skye bo rnams yang dag par gdon par 'dod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: su bying ba skyabs med la sdug bsngal ba'i skye bo rnams yang dag par gdon par 'dod pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to rescue those who are drowning, who are helpless, and who are suffering.

original: grub pa'i slob dpon l'u yi pa'i zhabs kyi smon pas bskul ba rnams gdon pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grub pa'i slob dpon l'u yi pa'i zhabs kyi smon pas bskul ba rnams gdon pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to rescue those who are urged on by the aspirations of the accomplished master Luipa.

original: lus ljon shing mchog ni dgongs pa'i tshig gis rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid gzhi'i rang bzhin gyi snang ba la sbyor ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lus ljon shing mchog ni dgongs pa'i tshig gis rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid gzhi'i rang bzhin gyi snang ba la sbyor ba gsungs te /
translated: The body, the supreme tree, is taught to be applied to the appearance of the nature of the basis, the pure nature of reality, with the words of the intention.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang / dbang po drug po rnams dang / khams rnams dang / yul rnams la gzung 'dzin du 'dzin pas lo ma dang 'dra bar @159a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang / dbang po drug po rnams dang / khams rnams dang / yul rnams la gzung 'dzin du 'dzin pas lo ma dang 'dra bar @159a * //
translated: The body is like a tree because it is illustrated by the leaves of the apprehension of the skandhas of form and so on, the six sense organs, the dhatus, and the objects as subject and object.

original: nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir lus ljon shing mchog tu gzung ngo //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir lus ljon shing mchog tu gzung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the body is apprehended as the supreme tree.

original: ci ste sems dang ldan pa'i phyir ji ltar lus ljon pa'i shing mchog ce na /
analyzed: ci ste sems dang ldan pa'i phyir ji ltar lus ljon pa'i shing mchog ce na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúSince it is endowed with mind, how is the body the supreme tree?‚Äù

original: 'di'i skyon med de /
analyzed: 'di'i skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: de bzhin du phyi'i bstan bcos byed pas kyang nye bar blta bar bya ba'i rgyan gzhan la sbyor ba rnams kyis cung zad dbye bar gnas pa de dang 'dra ba nyid la nya bar brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi'i bstan bcos byed pas kyang nye bar blta bar bya ba'i rgyan gzhan la sbyor ba rnams kyis cung zad dbye bar gnas pa de dang 'dra ba nyid la nya bar brjod do //
translated: In the same way, the author of an external treatise, by the application of the other ornaments of composition, which are to be examined, is slightly differentiated.

original: ci'i phyir brtags na rang bzhin du snang ba'i skyon gyi dbang las g-yo bde yis so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir brtags na rang bzhin du snang ba'i skyon gyi dbang las g-yo bde yis so //
translated: Why is it imagined? By the power of the fault of appearing as natural.

original: tha mal pa'i sems 'dzag pa'i rang bzhin gyis sgra gcan te /
analyzed: tha mal pa'i sems 'dzag pa'i rang bzhin gyis sgra gcan te /
translated: The ordinary mind is RƒÅhu by nature, a falling away.

original: de nyid kyi dus su nag po'i tshes gcig gi skabs su rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi dus su nag po'i tshes gcig gi skabs su rab tu 'jug go //
translated: At that time, it enters the phase of the first day of the dark lunar fortnight.

original: gang la / dga' ba dang / bzang po dang / rgyal ba dang / stong pa dang / gang ba rnams tshes kyi rim pas kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems ri dags mtshan skam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la / dga' ba dang / bzang po dang / rgyal ba dang / stong pa dang / gang ba rnams tshes kyi rim pas kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems ri dags mtshan skam par 'gyur ro //
translated: In which, the days of joy, goodness, victory, emptiness, and fullness, in the order of the lunar days, are the dry deer-marked stages of relative bodhicitta.

original: 'di khyad par du slob dpon nag po spyod pa'i zhabs kyis mngon par gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di khyad par du slob dpon nag po spyod pa'i zhabs kyis mngon par gsungs te /
translated: This is especially taught by the master K·πõ·π£·πáƒÅcƒÅryapƒÅda.

original: ri bo mchog gi mgul phug tu //
analyzed: ri bo mchog gi mgul phug tu //
translated: In the cave of the supreme mountain,

original: 'gro rnams ma lus kun chad gyur //
analyzed: 'gro rnams ma lus kun chad gyur //
translated: all beings without exception are cut off.

original: dri med chu rgyun skams nas 'gro //
analyzed: dri med chu rgyun skams nas 'gro //
translated: The stream of pure water dries up and goes.üîΩThe fire of time is fully engaged.

original: dus kyi me ni rab tu 'jug / de bzhin du ra ti badzra gyis kyang /
analyzed: dus kyi me ni rab tu 'jug / de bzhin du ra ti badzra gyis kyang /
translated: Similarly, RatnƒÅkara≈õƒÅnti says:

original: byang chub sems ni lhung gyur na //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni lhung gyur na //
translated: When the bodhicitta falls,

original: dngos grub kun gyi gter ni gang //
analyzed: dngos grub kun gyi gter ni gang //
translated: where is the treasure of all powers?

original: phung po rnam shes brgyal ba la //
analyzed: phung po rnam shes brgyal ba la //
translated: When the aggregates and consciousness faint,

original: 'dod pa'i dngos grub gang las 'byung //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos grub gang las 'byung //
translated: from where does the power of desire arise?

original: de bzhin du sam pu ta 'byung ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sam pu ta 'byung ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po las kyang /
translated: Similarly, the King of Tantras That Arises from the Sampu·π≠a says:üîΩThe mind, which is difficult to protect from the darkness

original: dpag med rnam rtog mun pas zil gnon pa'i //
analyzed: dpag med rnam rtog mun pas zil gnon pa'i //
translated: of immeasurable discursive thought,

original: rlung gis g-yo ba'i glog bzhin g-yo ba can //üîΩ'dod chags la sogs bsrung dka' dri ma yi //
analyzed: rlung gis g-yo ba'i glog bzhin g-yo ba can // 'dod chags la sogs bsrung dka' dri ma yi //
translated: is overcome by the lightning of the moving wind.üîΩThe vajra-holder says that the mind itself,üîΩwhich is difficult to protect from the stains of desire and so on,

original: sems nyid rdo rje can gyis 'khor bar gsungs //
analyzed: sems nyid rdo rje can gyis 'khor bar gsungs //
translated: is samsara.

original: de'i phyir gang 'ga' zhig phyogs gcig tu bcom ldan 'das kyis dge ba rnams yongs su smin pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang 'ga' zhig phyogs gcig tu bcom ldan 'das kyis dge ba rnams yongs su smin pa /
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn said that those who are not fully ripened in virtue

original: rim pa lnga pa'i thabs 'dzin pa la zhugs pa sngon du 'gro ba zung 'jug bcings pa'i ngo bo lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i 'bras bu rtag tu tshol ba na de yang rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim pa lnga pa'i thabs 'dzin pa la zhugs pa sngon du 'gro ba zung 'jug bcings pa'i ngo bo lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i 'bras bu rtag tu tshol ba na de yang rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is engaged in the practice of the five stages, who is preceded by the practice of the method of retention, who is always seeking the fruit of the innate joy, which is the nature of the bondage of union, will also manifest the vajra-like samadhi.

original: 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis gsungs te /
translated: The Arya Haribhadra says:

original: rim pa lnga'i go rims med na rdzogs pa'i rim pa yang dag pa'i byang chub mngon sum du byed pa thob @159b par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim pa lnga'i go rims med na rdzogs pa'i rim pa yang dag pa'i byang chub mngon sum du byed pa thob @159b par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Without the sequence of the five stages, the perfection stage will not be attained, which manifests perfect enlightenment.

original: brtan par mdzod cig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dis ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis sdom pa la sogs pa'i rim pas go rims ji lta ba bzhin du dbang bskur ba'i mchog rnal 'byor pas dam tshig gi brda'i rdzas kyis bla ma dam pa mnyes par
analyzed: brtan par mdzod cig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dis ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis sdom pa la sogs pa'i rim pas go rims ji lta ba bzhin du dbang bskur ba'i mchog rnal 'byor pas dam tshig gi brda'i rdzas kyis bla ma dam pa mnyes par
translated: The phrase you should be firm and so forth indicates that the yogin, by the stages of the vows and so forth of the spiritual friend, should please the holy guru with the pledge sign substances, and then request the supreme empowerment.

original: byas nas nam phyed na shes rab dang ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba thob pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: byas nas nam phyed na shes rab dang ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba thob pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtan par bya'o //
translated: Having done that, at midnight, one should stabilize the wisdom and gnosis initiations just as they were obtained.

original: de bzhin du bde ba chen po dga' ba bzhi pa nyid kun gyi tshad ma'o //üîΩl'u yis smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de la rdo rje dang chu skyes yang dag par sbyor bas mi 'dzag pa'i bde ba'i phyir dpal ldan bla ma la zhus na khyad par gyis dga' ba khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa des
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba chen po dga' ba bzhi pa nyid kun gyi tshad ma'o // l'u yis smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de la rdo rje dang chu skyes yang dag par sbyor bas mi 'dzag pa'i bde ba'i phyir dpal ldan bla ma la zhus na khyad par gyis dga' ba khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa des
translated: Thus, the great bliss of the fourth joy is the measure of all.üîΩThe joy of the special is the pervader and the pervaded by that.

original: chos thams cad dmigs pa med pa'i tshul gyis lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba bde ba chen po nyin dang mtshan du shes so //
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs pa med pa'i tshul gyis lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba bde ba chen po nyin dang mtshan du shes so //
translated: One should know day and night the innate joy, the great bliss, by the method of the non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: de bzhin du dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las kyang /
translated: Thus, in the glorious Guhyasamaja it is also said:

original: rdo rje bla ma dang bral na //
analyzed: rdo rje bla ma dang bral na //
translated: Without the vajra guru,üîΩone will not abandon all afflictions,

original: nyon mongs ma lus spangs pa dang // zhi ba myang 'das go 'phang dang // phyir mi ldog pa thob mi 'gyur //
analyzed: nyon mongs ma lus spangs pa dang // zhi ba myang 'das go 'phang dang // phyir mi ldog pa thob mi 'gyur //
translated: attain the state of nirvana, peace,üîΩor reach the stage of non-returning.

original: de bzhin du yang klu sgrub zhabs kyis kyang rdo rje'i bzlas pa las gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang klu sgrub zhabs kyis kyang rdo rje'i bzlas pa las gsungs te /
translated: Likewise, the venerable Nagarjuna also taught this in the Vajrapada:

original: 'ga' zhig ri dbang rtse las rab tu lhung gyur na //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ri dbang rtse las rab tu lhung gyur na //
translated: If someone falls from the peak of Mount Meru,

original: ltung bar mi 'dod na yang de bzhin rnam par ltung //
analyzed: ltung bar mi 'dod na yang de bzhin rnam par ltung //
translated: he does not want to fall, but he falls anyway.

original: bla ma'i drin gyis phan pa'i man ngag thob gyur na //
analyzed: bla ma'i drin gyis phan pa'i man ngag thob gyur na //
translated: If one obtains the beneficial instructions through the kindness of the guru,

original: grol bar mi 'dod na yang de bzhin grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: grol bar mi 'dod na yang de bzhin grol bar 'gyur //
translated: one does not want to be liberated, but one is liberated anyway.

original: sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis bshad sbyar las kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis bshad sbyar las kyang gsungs te /
translated: The venerable Saraha also taught this in the Pradipoddyotana:

original: gang zhig 'khor ba'i 'khor lo mi sgrub na //
analyzed: gang zhig 'khor ba'i 'khor lo mi sgrub na //
translated: If one does not accomplish the wheel of samsara,

original: bdag nyid ched du yid ni nyer sbyor zhing //
analyzed: bdag nyid ched du yid ni nyer sbyor zhing //
translated: one should apply the mind to the self.

original: de blo brtan pa dang bas zhugs gyur na //üîΩspros bral rang gi bdag po'i sa nyid do //
analyzed: de blo brtan pa dang bas zhugs gyur na // spros bral rang gi bdag po'i sa nyid do //
translated: If one enters with a stable and pure mind,üîΩone will attain the stage of the lord of simplicity.

original: de yang so so rang rig skye 'gyur te //
analyzed: de yang so so rang rig skye 'gyur te //
translated: This is born of individual self-awareness,

original: bde ba rtog pa'i dra ba las grol byed //üîΩdus kun du ni bla ma dam pa yis //
analyzed: bde ba rtog pa'i dra ba las grol byed // dus kun du ni bla ma dam pa yis //
translated: and it liberates one from the net of conceptual bliss.üîΩAt all times, one should respectfully bow one's head

original: de yi zhabs zung spyi bos gus par 'dud //
analyzed: de yi zhabs zung spyi bos gus par 'dud //
translated: to the feet of the sublime guru.

original: de bzhin du dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje las kyang /
translated: Likewise, the Shri-Heruka-tantra also says:

original: bsod nams nyid las bdag gis shes //
analyzed: bsod nams nyid las bdag gis shes //
translated: I know that merit itself

original: bla ma'i rim pa nyer bstan phyir //
analyzed: bla ma'i rim pa nyer bstan phyir //
translated: In order to show the stages of the guru,

original: rkang pa gzhan gyis 'dod chags chen po'i tshul gyi ting nge 'dzin nye bar gsal zhing rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gzhan gyis 'dod chags chen po'i tshul gyi ting nge 'dzin nye bar gsal zhing rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
translated: the other verse clarifies and praises the samadhi of the method of great desire.

original: @160a * // ma lus ting 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mtha' med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyis tshul gyi dbye ba ni mi dge ba bcu yongs su spangs pa'i phyir dang / dbang po rnams 'gog pa'i phyir nges par gsungs so //
analyzed: @160a * // ma lus ting 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mtha' med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyis tshul gyi dbye ba ni mi dge ba bcu yongs su spangs pa'i phyir dang / dbang po rnams 'gog pa'i phyir nges par gsungs so //
translated: The phrase all samadhis and so forth is stated by the Bhagavat himself with the divisions of the methods of limitless samadhis, which are definitely stated in order to abandon the ten non-virtues and in order to stop the senses.

original: ting nge 'dzin de rnams kyis 'dir bya ba cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de rnams kyis 'dir bya ba cung zad kyang med de /
translated: There is not the slightest action in those samadhis.

original: 'dod chags chen po'i tshul la bde ba dang bral ba'i phyir dka' thub dang smyung gnas la sogs pa'i nges pas so //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po'i tshul la bde ba dang bral ba'i phyir dka' thub dang smyung gnas la sogs pa'i nges pas so //
translated: Because of the method of great desire, there is no happiness, and there is no certainty of austerity, fasting, and so forth.

original: de'i phyir dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las /
translated: Therefore, in the Shri-Guhyasamaja

original: dka' spyad nges pa drag po yis //
analyzed: dka' spyad nges pa drag po yis //
translated: Through intense, certain hardship,

original: lus ni skams shing sdug bsngal te //
analyzed: lus ni skams shing sdug bsngal te //
translated: the body is dried up and suffers,

original: sdug bsngal las ni sems g-yeng byed //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las ni sems g-yeng byed //
translated: and from suffering, the mind is distracted.

original: rnam g-yeng las ni dngos grub gzhan //
analyzed: rnam g-yeng las ni dngos grub gzhan //
translated: From distraction, there is no spiritual attainment.

original: zhes so // de bzhin du dgyes pa rdo rje las kyang /
analyzed: zhes so // de bzhin du dgyes pa rdo rje las kyang /
translated: Similarly, the Hevajra Tantra teaches:

original: 'dod chags kyis ni 'jig rten 'ching //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis ni 'jig rten 'ching //
translated: The world is bound by desire.

original: 'dod chags kyis ni rnam grol pa'i //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis ni rnam grol pa'i //
translated: By desire, there is liberation.

original: skyed byed de nyid stong @162a * //

analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu nag ka ba dang rdzas la sogs par gyur pa ste rang bzhin gyis med pa'i gzugs zhes so // dpal he ru ka'i rgyud kyi de kho na nyid kyi le'u gsungs pa rnam par dpyod pa dmigs pa med pa de yis grub pa'i slob dpon ts'a t'i li pas zam pa zhes gsungs pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa gcig tu byed pa bla ma'i drin
translated: ‚ÄúForm that is not inherently existent‚Äù means that it is not a pot, a cloth, a black, a pillar, a substance, and so on.

original: dpal ldan he ru ka'i rgyud kyi rgyal por gsungs pa'i don mngon du byed pa las gang du gnas 'cha' ba ni bdag nyid kyis gnas par byed pa'o //

original: thams cad de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gang rnams kyis kyang rnal 'byor pa'i yid kyi spyod yul yid kyi dbang pos rtogs pa nyid gtso bor gyur te /

original: nyin re nyid re lhan cig skyes pa 'phro //
analyzed: nyin re nyid re lhan cig skyes pa 'phro //

original: byang dang lho zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni g-yon dang g-yas kyis snang ba gnyis po dbus su rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir lam sna tshogs pa'i dga' bar gyur pa byang chub kyi sems la rang gi ye shes yongs su sbyangs nas bde ba chen po'i 'khor
analyzed: byang dang lho zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni g-yon dang g-yas kyis snang ba gnyis po dbus su rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir lam sna tshogs pa'i dga' bar gyur pa byang chub kyi sems la rang gi ye shes yongs su sbyangs nas bde ba chen po'i 'khor

original: stobs chu'i rin chen phyogs bcu rnams su 'phro //

analyzed: ae wam yig zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bam yig zla ba'i snang ba ae yig nyi ma ste /

original: gnyis po @169a * //
analyzed: gnyis po @169a * //
translated: The twoüîΩare the two pillars of the wisdom of day and night.

analyzed: nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i shes rab ka ba gnyis mnyes nas snang ba med par byas te /

original: rdo rje bzlas pas gzhan sna tshogs pa'i rab tu byed pa aa wa dh'u t'i khyab byed 'gog pa phyung nas gsum po de rnams kyi dmigs pa med pa'i chang gi btung bas rab tu myos pa'o //

translated: By vajra repetition, the pervading of the avadh≈´tƒ´ is blocked, and by the third, the three are well intoxicated by the wine of the objectless state.

analyzed: yod pa'i shes pa la glang po che'i dbang por spyod pa'i zhabs kyis gsungs so //

original: chu skyes tshal ni bde ba chen po'i chu skyes kyi tshal du phyin na rnam par mi rtog par rol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: chu skyes tshal ni bde ba chen po'i chu skyes kyi tshal du phyin na rnam par mi rtog par rol bar byed pa'o //
translated: Having gone to the forest of the lotus of great bliss, one should enjoy without discursive thought.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: In the same way, the noble NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says:

analyzed: phyi rol gang de bden med rang bzhin bral //

original: shes pa yang ni phyi rol don bzhin no //
analyzed: shes pa yang ni phyi rol don bzhin no //

original: gang zhig stong par yongs su rtog byed na //
analyzed: gang zhig stong par yongs su rtog byed na //

analyzed: de nyid yongs su rtog pa'i dngos tshogs ni //

original: de nyid med la de nyid gcig pa'i blos //
analyzed: de nyid med la de nyid gcig pa'i blos //
translated: The mind that is one with the absence of reality

original: sgyur ma'i gang mkhan gar gyi bya ba la //

original: gar mkhan rnal 'byor dbang phyug rtse bar byed ;
analyzed: gar mkhan rnal 'byor dbang phyug rtse bar byed ;

original: / rkang pa gzhan gyi sa de nyid gsungs pa ste //üîΩji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar phyi rol du glang po che glang mo la chags pa'i myos pas rgyug par byed do //
analyzed: / rkang pa gzhan gyi sa de nyid gsungs pa ste // ji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar phyi rol du glang po che glang mo la chags pa'i myos pas rgyug par byed do //
translated: The other verse states the same reality:üîΩAs it is, as it is, the mind, intoxicated by attachment to the external female, runs about.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das bdag med ma la chags pa de yis sems ni glang po che'i dbang po nag po spyod pa pa'i zhabs kyi de bzhin nyid kyi chang rab tu 'bab par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das bdag med ma la chags pa de yis sems ni glang po che'i dbang po nag po spyod pa pa'i zhabs kyi de bzhin nyid kyi chang rab tu 'bab par byed do //

original: de'i phyir rkang pa gsum pas dongs po dang dngos po med pa'i dmigs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rkang pa gsum pas dongs po dang dngos po med pa'i dmigs pa gsungs te /

original: 'gro drug ces bya ba la sogs pa ni sgo nga la sa skyes pa dang / mngal las skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa dang / rdzu sa te skyes pa'i lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pa'i 'gro ba drug po rnams kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su dag pa'i skra'i rtse mo tsam yang ma dag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro drug ces bya ba la sogs pa ni sgo nga la sa skyes pa dang / mngal las skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa dang / rdzu sa te skyes pa'i lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pa'i 'gro ba drug po rnams kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su dag pa'i skra'i rtse mo tsam yang ma dag pa med pa'o //
translated: The six classes of beings and so on refers to the six classes of beings, those born from eggs, those born from wombs, those born from heat and moisture, and the gods, demigods and so on born miraculously, who are all lords of yoga, in whom all things are pure by nature, not even a hair tip of impurity.

original: de bzhin du dbu ma'i bstan bcos las /

original: yang dag nyid la yang dag ltar //
analyzed: yang dag nyid la yang dag ltar //

original: yang dag mthong na rnam par grol //
analyzed: yang dag mthong na rnam par grol //

translated: The ten powers and so forth refer to the experience of the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, and so forth, which are the jewels of suchness that pervade the ten directions. It is the expansion of one's own through the power of familiarity with that.

analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyi rin po che'i mthus tha rig pa'i glang po che'i dbang po ma chags pa'i myos pa gang las so //
translated: Therefore, by the power of the jewel of suchness, the intoxicated elephant of the mind is controlled by non-attachment.

original: de sha kha zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs nag po spyod pa'i zhabs kyis so//
analyzed: de sha kha zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs nag po spyod pa'i zhabs kyis so//

analyzed: kye'i g-yung mo khyod dang mnyam 'grogs bya //

translated: I ask you, O Yoginƒ´, the truth about

original: de kho na nyid kyi don bdag med pa'i chos khong du chud pa nag po spyod pa'i zhabs kyis g-yung mo'i sgras dgongs pa'i skad kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi don bdag med pa'i chos khong du chud pa nag po spyod pa'i zhabs kyis g-yung mo'i sgras dgongs pa'i skad kyis gsungs te /
translated: The one who has realized the meaning of reality, the Dharma of selflessness, the venerable K·πõ·π£·πáƒÅcƒÅrya, has spoken with the word Yoginƒ´ in the language of the intention.

original: grong khyer zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi reg pa'i sbyor ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: grong khyer zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi reg pa'i sbyor ba'i phyir te /
translated: The city, etc., is for the purpose of the practice of non-contact.

original: g-yung mo ni yongs su dag pa'i aa wa dh'u t'i bdag med par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yung mo ni yongs su dag pa'i aa wa dh'u t'i bdag med par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The Yoginƒ´ should be understood as the selflessness of the completely pure avadh≈´tƒ´.

analyzed: bram ze zhes pa ni bram ze h'um yig gi sa bon la skyes pa g-yo ba'i sbyor ba la sems ni bram ze'i bu'o //
translated: The Brahmin is the seed syllable of the Brahmin, the Hum, and the mind is the son of the Brahmin, the movement in the union.

original: man ngang thob pa'i rnal 'byor pas byang chub kyi sems kun rdzob khu ba'i gzugs nor bu'i rtsa ba las dga' bral la reg kyin reg kyin khyod 'gro ste kye bdag med ma'i 'grong khyer la zhes so //
analyzed: man ngang thob pa'i rnal 'byor pas byang chub kyi sems kun rdzob khu ba'i gzugs nor bu'i rtsa ba las dga' bral la reg kyin reg kyin khyod 'gro ste kye bdag med ma'i 'grong khyer la zhes so //
translated: The yogi who has attained the state of the mind of enlightenment, the relative form of the seminal essence, should go to the root of the jewel, to the separation from joy, and touch it again and again, saying, ‚ÄúO you, take me to the house of Nairatma.‚Äù

original: de phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs par shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the external form, etc., of the assembly.

original: dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyis bla ma'i man ngang gis khyod kyi khyim ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo la bdag grub pa'i slob dpon nag po zhabs kyis rtogs pa zhes so //
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyis bla ma'i man ngang gis khyod kyi khyim ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo la bdag grub pa'i slob dpon nag po zhabs kyis rtogs pa zhes so //
translated: The house is the wheel of great bliss, because it is not the domain of the senses, and it is realized by the teacher, the accomplished one, Krishna.

original: kye'i g-yung mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kye'i g-yung mo ni bdag med ma khyod dang bdag lhan cig mngon par 'khyud par bya'o //
analyzed: kye'i g-yung mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kye'i g-yung mo ni bdag med ma khyod dang bdag lhan cig mngon par 'khyud par bya'o //
translated: O Nairatma, etc. means that O Nairatma, you and I should embrace each other.

original: gang dang 'dra ba'i gnas de dang 'dra ba dag la bdag ni skyug bro ba dang ngo tsho ba la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba'o//
analyzed: gang dang 'dra ba'i gnas de dang 'dra ba dag la bdag ni skyug bro ba dang ngo tsho ba la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba'o//
translated: I am free from the faults of disgust, shame, etc. with respect to those places that are similar to that one.

original: @170a * // de bas na bdag rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'dzin pas thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can phyag rgya chen pa'i dngos grub 'thob bo //
analyzed: @170a * // de bas na bdag rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'dzin pas thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can phyag rgya chen pa'i dngos grub 'thob bo //
translated: Therefore, I always attain the power of the Great Seal, which is the nature of method and wisdom, by uninterrupted retention.

original: ji ltar dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje las kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje las kyang /
translated: And as the Shri-Heruka Tantra teaches:

original: thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid rgyud //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid rgyud //
translated: The tantra is the nature of method and wisdom.

original: de la bdag gis bshad kyis nyon //
analyzed: de la bdag gis bshad kyis nyon //
translated: Listen to what I will explain about that.

original: rkang pa gnyis pas goms pa'i gnas gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pas goms pa'i gnas gsungs te /
translated: The second line teaches the place of practice.

original: gcig nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni sprul pa'i 'khor lor padma 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi dang ldan pa la de la gnas pa'i bcom ldan 'das bdag med ma dang lhan cig ro gcig de yis chags pa chen po'i dga' bas shin tu yid du
analyzed: gcig nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni sprul pa'i 'khor lor padma 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi dang ldan pa la de la gnas pa'i bcom ldan 'das bdag med ma dang lhan cig ro gcig de yis chags pa chen po'i dga' bas shin tu yid du
translated: The one called the single one is the emanation wheel, which has sixty-four lotus petals. There, the Bhagavati Nairatmya, who resides there, is of one taste with him, and by the joy of great passion, she is very pleasing.

original: 'ong ba nyid kyis nag po spyod pa pa gar byed do //
analyzed: 'ong ba nyid kyis nag po spyod pa pa gar byed do //
translated: She is black, and she dances.

original: de bzhin du dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje las kyang gar ni he ru ka gzugs kyis //üîΩrjes dran thob pa sbyor ba las //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje las kyang gar ni he ru ka gzugs kyis // rjes dran thob pa sbyor ba las //
translated: The dance is the form of Heruka.

original: rkang pa gsum pas bdag med ma khong du chud pa brtan par byed do //
analyzed: rkang pa gsum pas bdag med ma khong du chud pa brtan par byed do //
translated: The third line stabilizes the realization of Nairatmya.

original: kye'i khyod ces bya ba la sogs pa ni kye'i bdag med ma bden pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi bsam pas khyod la bdag gis dris pa'o //
analyzed: kye'i khyod ces bya ba la sogs pa ni kye'i bdag med ma bden pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi bsam pas khyod la bdag gis dris pa'o //
translated: The line beginning O, you is addressed to Nairatmya, and means I ask you, with the thought of the nature of true things.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa de'i gang gis kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems kyi gru'i lam gyis khyod kyis 'gro ba dang 'ong ba byed pa khyod yis mi byed do zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa de'i gang gis kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems kyi gru'i lam gyis khyod kyis 'gro ba dang 'ong ba byed pa khyod yis mi byed do zhes pa'i don te /
translated: You do not go and come by the path of the boat of relative bodhichitta, which is the selflessness of all things.

original: thams cad lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis zhes so //
analyzed: thams cad lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis zhes so //
translated: It means that all things are of the nature of coemergence.

original: gang la mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i dus su sems kyi rnga mo des 'od gsal 'dren pas na mnan par gyur pa ni kun du 'gro bas de'i tshe rtsa gsum cu so gnyis lha'i gzugs so ;

translated: The action of that is the mouse of the mind and the wind, which is oneself,üîΩacting by way of the activity of the various instants of the body's joy, etc.,

analyzed: bla ma yis ni don dam gsungs pa'i lam gyi rim pa ting 'dzin sgro glegs can //
translated: The Guru has taught the stages of the path of the ultimate truth, the scriptures of the samƒÅdhi.

original: chu skyes rnams rgyas gsung la gshin rje'i rgyal med chu skyes sbrang rtsi bung ba 'thung //
analyzed: chu skyes rnams rgyas gsung la gshin rje'i rgyal med chu skyes sbrang rtsi bung ba 'thung //
translated: The bees drink the honey of the lotus, which is the Guru‚Äôs speech, which is free from the king of death.

original: rkang pa bzhi pas rdo rje bla ma'i bdag nyid che ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi pas rdo rje bla ma'i bdag nyid che ba gsungs te /
translated: The fourth line declares the greatness of the Guru, who is like a vajra.

original: da'i tshe zhes bya ba la sog pa ni sems kyi byi ba 'di de srid pa de ni rmongs pa dang nga rgyal zhi bar mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: da'i tshe zhes bya ba la sog pa ni sems kyi byi ba 'di de srid pa de ni rmongs pa dang nga rgyal zhi bar mi 'gyur ro /
translated: ‚Äú At that time‚Äù and so on. As long as the mouse of the mind is not pacified, delusion and pride will not be pacified.

original: gang gi tshe chu skyes kyi tshal du song nas bla ma dam pa'i gsung gi 'khrul 'khor gyis nyams su myong bar byed do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chu skyes kyi tshal du song nas bla ma dam pa'i gsung gi 'khrul 'khor gyis nyams su myong bar byed do //
translated: When one goes to the forest of the lotus, one should experience the Guru‚Äôs speech with the machine of the body.

original: kye'i rnal 'byor pa de'i phyir bla ma'i bzhed pa btsal bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: kye'i rnal 'byor pa de'i phyir bla ma'i bzhed pa btsal bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: ‚Äú O yogi, therefore, you should seek the Guru‚Äôs will.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: In the same way, the venerable Saraha says:

original: gang gi drin gyi 'od zer gyis /
analyzed: gang gi drin gyi 'od zer gyis /
translated: By the grace of the Guru‚Äôs light rays,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
translated: and so on.

original: ; rkang pa lnga pas sems kyi byi ba'i rang bzhin gsungs te /
analyzed: ; rkang pa lnga pas sems kyi byi ba'i rang bzhin gsungs te /
translated: The fifth line states the nature of the mind-rat.

original: gang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi tshe lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba la sems kyi byi ba rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi tshe lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba la sems kyi byi ba rgyu ba'o //
translated: Where and so on means that when the mind-rat moves about in the pleasure of the innate,

original: nga zhes rkyen gyis brtags pa rgyun gcod pa'o //
analyzed: nga zhes rkyen gyis brtags pa rgyun gcod pa'o //
translated: I is the cutting off of the continuity of the conceptualized.

original: de'i tshe 'khor bar 'ching ba gcod ba'o ;
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khor bar 'ching ba gcod ba'o ;
translated: At that time, the bondage of cyclic existence is cut.

original: / de bzhin du lung las kyang //
analyzed: / de bzhin du lung las kyang //
translated: Thus, it is said in the scriptures:

original: de nyid la ni 'khor ba med //
analyzed: de nyid la ni 'khor ba med //
translated: In reality, there is no cyclic existence.

original: lus 'dzin 'ching ba 'dir gang las //
analyzed: lus 'dzin 'ching ba 'dir gang las //
translated: From where in this world

original: 'ga' zhig gang du 'chi med 'gro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gang du 'chi med 'gro //
translated: would anyone go to deathlessness?

original: de bzhin grol byas grol bar bya //
analyzed: de bzhin grol byas grol bar bya //
translated: Thus, having been liberated, one is liberated.

original: log par sgro btags byas de las //
analyzed: log par sgro btags byas de las //
translated: From that which is wrongly imagined,

original: thag sbrul grib ma sha za 'khrul //
analyzed: thag sbrul grib ma sha za 'khrul //
translated: the confusion of rope, snake, shadow, and zombie arises.

original: cung zad ma spangs ma bzung bar //
analyzed: cung zad ma spangs ma bzung bar //
translated: Without abandoning or grasping even the slightest,

original: rol pas legs gnas skabs ji bzhin //
analyzed: rol pas legs gnas skabs ji bzhin //
translated: one abides well in the state of play.

original: gunydza ri zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis so //
analyzed: gunydza ri zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis so //
translated: This is the song called Gunja-ri, sung by the venerable Saraha.

original: rang gi rtogs byas 'khor ba mya nyan 'das //
analyzed: rang gi rtogs byas 'khor ba mya nyan 'das //
translated: One's own realization is cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: log ltas 'jig rten rang nyid 'ching bar byed //
analyzed: log ltas 'jig rten rang nyid 'ching bar byed //
translated: Wrong views bind the world to itself.

original: bdag gis mi @181a * //
analyzed: bdag gis mi @181a * //
translated: I do not know,

original: shes bsam med rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: shes bsam med rnal 'byor pa //
translated: I am a yogi who has no thoughts.

original: skye dang 'chi ba'i srid pa ji ltar yin //
analyzed: skye dang 'chi ba'i srid pa ji ltar yin //
translated: How is there birth and death?

original: ji ltar skye dang 'chi ba de bzhin du //
analyzed: ji ltar skye dang 'chi ba de bzhin du //
translated: Just as there is birth and death,

original: gson dang shi ba dag la khyad par med //
analyzed: gson dang shi ba dag la khyad par med //
translated: there is no difference between living and dying.

original: gang 'dir skye 'chi dag la the tshom med //
analyzed: gang 'dir skye 'chi dag la the tshom med //
translated: Here, there is no doubt about birth and death.

original: de byed gser 'gyur bcud len sgrub par byed //
analyzed: de byed gser 'gyur bcud len sgrub par byed //

original: gang gi g-yo dang mi g-yor bcas par 'khyam //
analyzed: gang gi g-yo dang mi g-yor bcas par 'khyam //

original: de rnams rga dang 'chi bar cis mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de rnams rga dang 'chi bar cis mi 'gyur //
translated: will they not age and die?

original: skye las las sam ci ste las las skye //
analyzed: skye las las sam ci ste las las skye //
translated: Is birth from karma or is karma from birth?

original: sa ra has smras bsam med pa de chos //
analyzed: sa ra has smras bsam med pa de chos //
translated: Saraha says: The inconceivable is the Dharma.

original: don de nyid chos thams cad khong du chud pa'i sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: don de nyid chos thams cad khong du chud pa'i sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis gsungs te /
translated: The venerable Saraha, who has realized the meaning of all the Dharmas, has said this:

original: rang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi skyon gyis srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa rtog par sgro btags shing byas pa'i phyir 'jig rten 'dir 'khyam zhing rang nyid kyis srid par 'ching ba dang grolüîΩbar byed ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi skyon gyis srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa rtog par sgro btags shing byas pa'i phyir 'jig rten 'dir 'khyam zhing rang nyid kyis srid par 'ching ba dang grol bar byed ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The line by oneself and so on means that one wanders in this world because of the error of the latent tendencies of beginningless ignorance, superimposing the concepts of cyclic existence and nirvana, and one binds oneself to cyclic existence and liberates oneself from it.

original: dhr'u'i rkang pas rang gi ye shes brtan par byed de /
analyzed: dhr'u'i rkang pas rang gi ye shes brtan par byed de /
translated: The line beginning with dhruva stabilizes one's gnosis.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i slob dpon sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis de lta bu nyid gsungs pa ni bla ma'i zhabs kyi drin las dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pas bsam du med pa'i rnal 'byor pa bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i slob dpon sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis de lta bu nyid gsungs pa ni bla ma'i zhabs kyi drin las dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pas bsam du med pa'i rnal 'byor pa bdag nyid do //
translated: By myself and so on means that the glorious Saraha, the great lord of yogis, says that he is a yogi who is inconceivable because he thoroughly knows the nature of things through the kindness of the guru's feet.

original: de'i phyir skye dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jig rten pa ji lta ba bzhin du gyur pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jig rten pa ji lta ba bzhin du gyur pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, birth and so on means that he is just like a worldly person.

original: de bzhin du yang tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bcom ldan 'das ma la skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i skyon dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bcom ldan 'das ma la skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i skyon dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the same way, in one verse, to the Blessed Lady, [he says], ‚ÄúFree from the faults of arising, enduring, and disintegrating.

original: rkang pa gnyis pas skye ba'i rang bzhin gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pas skye ba'i rang bzhin gsungs te /
translated: In the second line, he speaks of the nature of arising.

original: gang 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thams cad bdag med par khong du chud pas gang gi skye ba yod de /
analyzed: gang 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thams cad bdag med par khong du chud pas gang gi skye ba yod de /
translated: [He says], ‚ÄúHere, where everything is understood to be selfless, whose arising is there?‚Äù

original: kye'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug rang nyid kyi bdag la 'bod par byed do//
analyzed: kye'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug rang nyid kyi bdag la 'bod par byed do//
translated: O Lord of Yogins, he addresses himself.

original: gang la skye ba med pa de la 'chi ba yang ma mthong ste /
analyzed: gang la skye ba med pa de la 'chi ba yang ma mthong ste /
translated: Where there is no arising, there is also no seeing of death.

original: de bzhin du yang gnyis su med pa sgrub pa las //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gnyis su med pa sgrub pa las //
translated: In the same way, in the Tattva-advaya-siddhi,

original: rang gi rang bzhin skye med pa //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin skye med pa //
translated: [he says], ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own nature is non-arisen.

original: de nyid 'jig par ma mthong ste //
analyzed: de nyid 'jig par ma mthong ste //
translated: That itself is not seen to perish.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs //
translated: Abandoning all conceptual thoughts,

original: de ni gnyis med ye shes ming //
analyzed: de ni gnyis med ye shes ming //
translated: That is called non-dual wisdom.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir @181b skyes bu gson pa dang shi ba dag la lhan cig dbyer mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir @181b skyes bu gson pa dang shi ba dag la lhan cig dbyer mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, a living person and a dead person are not observed to be inseparable.

original: de bzhin du su ta ke las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du su ta ke las kyang /
translated: Similarly, S≈´taka says:

original: rmi lam dang ni rab sad gzhan du dbye ba med //
analyzed: rmi lam dang ni rab sad gzhan du dbye ba med //
translated: There is no difference between being asleep and being awake.

original: rnam par rtog byed rmi lam 'bras bu mngon 'dong can //
analyzed: rnam par rtog byed rmi lam 'bras bu mngon 'dong can //
translated: The one who conceptualizes is one who pursues the results of dreams.

original: rkang pa gsum pas rang nyid kyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gsum pas rang nyid kyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
translated: The third line praises his own position.

original: gang la 'chi ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa'ang yod pa'i rnal 'byor pa de yang gser 'gyur la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i cho ga rab tu sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: gang la 'chi ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa'ang yod pa'i rnal 'byor pa de yang gser 'gyur la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i cho ga rab tu sbyor bar byed do //
translated: The yogi who has the fear of death, etc., also applies various methods such as alchemy.

original: bdag ni slar yang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa'i the tshom gyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: bdag ni slar yang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa'i the tshom gyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gzugs so //
translated: I, however, am free of the conceptual thought of doubt about the fear of death, etc.

original: rkang pa bzhi pas slar yang rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi pas slar yang rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
translated: The fourth line again praises his own position.

original: gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang 'dzam bu'i gling gi gnas chen por g-yo ba dang mi g-yo bar bcas par 'khyam par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang 'dzam bu'i gling gi gnas chen por g-yo ba dang mi g-yo bar bcas par 'khyam par byed do //
translated: The one who, etc. refers to the yogi who is a child, who wanders in the great places of Jambudvipa, with the moving and unmoving.

original: yang na sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i nus pas sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas su bgrod par byed do //
analyzed: yang na sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i nus pas sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas su bgrod par byed do //
translated: Or, by the power of mantra, medicine, etc., he goes to the abode of the Thirty-Three.

original: de yang bla ma'i lam thob nas 'chi ba med pa nyid thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang bla ma'i lam thob nas 'chi ba med pa nyid thob pa ma yin no //
translated: And, having attained the path of the guru, he does not attain immortality.

original: bdag ni bcad du med cing gzhig tu med pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: bdag ni bcad du med cing gzhig tu med pa'i gzugs so //
translated: I am the form that cannot be cut or destroyed.

original: rkang pa lnga pas lam gyi bdag nyid kyi che ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa lnga pas lam gyi bdag nyid kyi che ba gsungs te /
translated: The fifth line states the greatness of the nature of the path.

original: skye ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byed pa po dang las bral ba'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi skye ba las las su ji ltar 'gyur te las las kyang skye ba yang ngo //
analyzed: skye ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byed pa po dang las bral ba'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi skye ba las las su ji ltar 'gyur te las las kyang skye ba yang ngo //
translated: Birth, etc. refers to the lord of yoga, who is free from agent and action. How can there be birth from action? And also birth from non-action.

original: de'i phyir sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang rang gi bzheng pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang rang gi bzheng pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, Saraha also states his own position:

original: don dam par rig pa'i rnal 'byor pa la bsam du med pa'i phyir chos nyid do //
analyzed: don dam par rig pa'i rnal 'byor pa la bsam du med pa'i phyir chos nyid do //
translated: Ultimately, because there is nothing to think for the yogin of awareness, it is reality.

original: ba r'a li zhes bya ba'i glu dbyang 'du shes gsum pa'i zhabs kyi'o //
analyzed: ba r'a li zhes bya ba'i glu dbyang 'du shes gsum pa'i zhabs kyi'o //
translated: This is the song of the Varahi sung by the feet of the third perception.

original: gang tshe bhu su ku khyod rngon 'gro skye bo lnga po song //
analyzed: gang tshe bhu su ku khyod rngon 'gro skye bo lnga po song //
translated: When you go hunting, O Bh≈´suku, go with five people.

original: padma'i tshal du rab tu 'jug na yid ni gcig tu gyis //
analyzed: padma'i tshal du rab tu 'jug na yid ni gcig tu gyis //
translated: When you enter the lotus grove, be single-minded.

original: gson po gsod par ma byed shi ba'i ro ni ma blang cig / sha ni med par bhu su ku pa khyim du 'jug ma byed //
analyzed: gson po gsod par ma byed shi ba'i ro ni ma blang cig / sha ni med par bhu su ku pa khyim du 'jug ma byed //
translated: Do not kill the living, do not take the dead corpse, do not enter the Bh≈´suku house without meat.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba brkyang nas sgyu ma'i ri dags gsad par gyis //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba brkyang nas sgyu ma'i ri dags gsad par gyis //
translated: Having spread the net of illusion, kill the illusory deer.

original: bla ma dam pa'i gsung gis go byed gang du gang gis gtam //
analyzed: bla ma dam pa'i gsung gis go byed gang du gang gis gtam //
translated: By the words of the holy guru, understand wherever and by whom the talk is.

original: lus ni bdag gi snod yin ae ma @182a * //
analyzed: lus ni bdag gi snod yin ae ma @182a * //
translated: The body is the vessel of the self, alas!

original: sa chu me dang zas //
analyzed: sa chu me dang zas //
translated: Earth, water, fire, and food.

original: dus dang dus min gnyis gzar rlung lam sbyar tshod skyabs dkrug / rgya dang rdo lcags thag pa med par ri dags rgyag cing bros //
analyzed: dus dang dus min gnyis gzar rlung lam sbyar tshod skyabs dkrug / rgya dang rdo lcags thag pa med par ri dags rgyag cing bros //
translated: The two steep slopes of time and untimely, the wind path, the disturbance of the measure of refuge, without the rope of leather, iron, and rope, chase and throw the deer.

original: mchong zhing mtshon zhing brgyug pas nam mkha'i mthil du nub par gyur //
analyzed: mchong zhing mtshon zhing brgyug pas nam mkha'i mthil du nub par gyur //
translated: Jumping, striking, and running, he disappeared into the depths of the sky.

original: bhu su ku pa mtshan mo nam ni rab tu langs par gyur //
analyzed: bhu su ku pa mtshan mo nam ni rab tu langs par gyur //
translated: The night was well advanced, and the jackal,

original: don de nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' bas bskul ba'i yid kyi grub pa'i slob dpon bhu su ku'i zhabs kyis ri dags kyi dgongs pa rnam par sgom par byed pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: don de nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' bas bskul ba'i yid kyi grub pa'i slob dpon bhu su ku'i zhabs kyis ri dags kyi dgongs pa rnam par sgom par byed pa nyid kyis so //
translated: urged on by the joy of the moment, the spiritual teacher of the Siddhas, reflected on the deer's intention.

original: gang gi tshe khyod ces bya ba la sogs pa ni kye'i bhu su ku khyod gal te lus rlung gi ri dags lus kyi rlung gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyod ces bya ba la sogs pa ni kye'i bhu su ku khyod gal te lus rlung gi ri dags lus kyi rlung gi ngo bo'o //
translated: When you, etc. means: O jackal, if you, the deer of the wind, the essence of the wind of the body,

original: rngon pa zhes pa ni rang bzhin med par byed pa'i thabs tshol bas 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: rngon pa zhes pa ni rang bzhin med par byed pa'i thabs tshol bas 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: the hunter, should go in search of a means to make it lifeless.

original: de'i tshe yul lnga rnams la gzugs kyi phung por gyur pa me long lta bu'i sa'i khams mig gi dbang po la sogs pa la dkyil 'khor rnams sdud pa'i rim pas gsod pa ni rang bzhin med par byed pa thog mar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yul lnga rnams la gzugs kyi phung por gyur pa me long lta bu'i sa'i khams mig gi dbang po la sogs pa la dkyil 'khor rnams sdud pa'i rim pas gsod pa ni rang bzhin med par byed pa thog mar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, in the five objects, the form aggregate, the earth element, the eye faculty, and so on, the mandalas are gathered in stages, and the killing is the initial action of making them natureless.

original: slar yang rdo rje'i bzlas pas snang ba gnyis po 'gog cing yang dag par rdo rje dang chu skyes mnyam du sbyor ba bla ma'i drin las bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor chu skyes tshal du rab tu zhugs pa la //
analyzed: slar yang rdo rje'i bzlas pas snang ba gnyis po 'gog cing yang dag par rdo rje dang chu skyes mnyam du sbyor ba bla ma'i drin las bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor chu skyes tshal du rab tu zhugs pa la //
translated: Again, with vajra repetition, the two appearances are blocked, and the vajra and lotus are united, and through the guru‚Äôs kindness, one enters the lotus grove of the cakra of great bliss.

original: yid gcig tu byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa med par 'gyur ba rang nyid kyis bdag la yang dag par 'bod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid gcig tu byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa med par 'gyur ba rang nyid kyis bdag la yang dag par 'bod par byed pa'o //
translated: The mind becomes one-pointed, and without conceptuality, one calls to oneself.

original: de'i phyir dhr'u'i rkang pas brtan pa la dmigs pa gsal por byed pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dhr'u'i rkang pas brtan pa la dmigs pa gsal por byed pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the half-verse of DH·πö is stated for the sake of clarity in observing stability.

original: gson po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rab tu zhugs pa'i dbugs ni gson po la aom yig nyin mo'i shes pas rang bzhin bzhi bcu'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gson po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rab tu zhugs pa'i dbugs ni gson po la aom yig nyin mo'i shes pas rang bzhin bzhi bcu'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The living one, etc. The inhaled breath is the living one, endowed with the nature of the forty phonemes, by virtue of the consciousness of the day, the letter OM.

original: dbyung ba'i dbugs shi ba'i ro h'um yig mtshan mo'i shes pa'i rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dbyung ba'i dbugs shi ba'i ro h'um yig mtshan mo'i shes pa'i rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The exhaled breath is the dead corpse, by virtue of the consciousness of the night, the letter HUM, which is of the nature of the thirty-three phonemes.

original: gnas pa'i dbugs kyi bzhi a'a:yig ma ning gi shes pa'i rang bzhin bdun gyi rang bzhin dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i dbugs kyi bzhi a'a:yig ma ning gi shes pa'i rang bzhin bdun gyi rang bzhin dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The breath in the pause is endowed with the nature of the seven phonemes, by virtue of the neuter consciousness, the letter A.

original: de bzhin du phyag na rdo rjes kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyag na rdo rjes kyang /
translated: And likewise Vajrapani:

original: aom yig gis 'jug sems can rnams //
analyzed: aom yig gis 'jug sems can rnams //
translated: By the letter OM, all living beingsüîΩare constantly absorbed into the supreme body of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas sku nyid mchog @182b tu rtag / h'um yig 'byin byed sems can rnams //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sku nyid mchog @182b tu rtag / h'um yig 'byin byed sems can rnams //
translated: By the letter HUM, all living beings are exhaled,

original: a'a: yig gis ni gnas par byed //
analyzed: a'a: yig gis ni gnas par byed //
translated: and by the letter A, they are caused to abide.üîΩAnd likewise, it is said in detail:

original: de bzhin du snang ba mtshan mo'i cha nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du snang ba mtshan mo'i cha nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: The light of the moon, by virtue of the night,üîΩis the exhaled breath, the letter HUM.üîΩThe light of the sun, by virtue of the day,üîΩis the inhaled breath, the letter OM.üîΩThe light of the stars, by virtue of the pause,üîΩis the breath in the pause, the letter A.

original: dang por srog la sogs pa'i shes pa dbu mar rab tu zhugs par byas nas de'i rjes su sha ni dgongs pa'i skad kyi khyad par gyi dga' ba rang byin gyis brlab pa'i ngo bo nyid bzhi pa'i dga' pas ma sbyangs na kye'i bhu su ku'i zhabs bde
analyzed: dang por srog la sogs pa'i shes pa dbu mar rab tu zhugs par byas nas de'i rjes su sha ni dgongs pa'i skad kyi khyad par gyi dga' ba rang byin gyis brlab pa'i ngo bo nyid bzhi pa'i dga' pas ma sbyangs na kye'i bhu su ku'i zhabs bde
translated: First, having caused the consciousness of life-force and so on to enterüîΩthe central nƒÅ·∏çƒ´, after that, if one is not trained by the joy of the fourthüîΩstage, which is the nature of the self-empowerment of joy, the specialüîΩlanguage of the intention, then the feet of Khye'i Bhu su ku are blissful.üîΩ

original: ba chen po'i khyim du 'jug par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: ba chen po'i khyim du 'jug par mi byed pa'o //
translated: First, having caused the consciousnesses of life-force and so forth to enter the central channel, then, if one has not trained in the four joys that are the nature of the self-consecration of the special language of the Buddha, one will not enter the house of great bliss.

original: de bzhin du rim pa lnga las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rim pa lnga las kyang /
translated: Thus, the Five Stages also says:

original: mtshan mo ma yin mtshams kyang min //
analyzed: mtshan mo ma yin mtshams kyang min //
translated: Not at night, not in the intervals,

original: nyin mo yang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyin mo yang ni ma yin no //
translated: not even during the day.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so forth.

original: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: Thus, Saraha also says:

original: dbang po gang du nub cing mi gnas rang bzhin la //
analyzed: dbang po gang du nub cing mi gnas rang bzhin la //
translated: Where the faculties have set and do not abide naturally,

original: kye'i lhan cig skyes dga' bla ma'i zhabs la dris //
analyzed: kye'i lhan cig skyes dga' bla ma'i zhabs la dris //
translated: ask the guru, the friend who is the joy of the innate.

original: rkang pa gnyis pas lam gyi thabs gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pas lam gyi thabs gsungs te /
translated: The second line teaches the method of the path.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgyu ma zhes pa ni las kyi yan lag tu rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgyu ma zhes pa ni las kyi yan lag tu rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The illusion in the illusion net and so forth should be understood as a branch of the action.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa la sogs pa'i skad cig la thob pa de'i bde ba la tshogs pa'i lus la dra ba gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa la sogs pa'i skad cig la thob pa de'i bde ba la tshogs pa'i lus la dra ba gzhag pa ste /
translated: The bliss that is attained in the moment of the various kinds of sexual union is placed in the body of the assembly.

original: de yis lus kyi ri dags 'ching bar byed pa bla ma'i zhabs kyi drin las de'i ngo bo khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de yis lus kyi ri dags 'ching bar byed pa bla ma'i zhabs kyi drin las de'i ngo bo khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: By that, the deer of the body is bound. One should understand its nature through the kindness of the guru's feet.

original: de'i phyir de la bde ba nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo nyid thob pa de'i tshe gang du yang brjod par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la bde ba nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo nyid thob pa de'i tshe gang du yang brjod par mi nus pa'o //
translated: Therefore, when the bliss that is attained in the experience of that nature is inexpressible.

original: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: Similarly, Saraha also says:

original: dga' bas mnyes gshin 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dga' bas mnyes gshin 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The world is pleased by joy, and so on.

original: rkang pa gsum pas goms pa'i khyad par du gsungs so //
analyzed: rkang pa gsum pas goms pa'i khyad par du gsungs so //
translated: The third line speaks of the special practice.

original: lus snod ces bya ba la sogs pa'i lus nyid ni bdag gi snod gzhir gyur pa de las 'byung ba chen po lngar gyur pa'i rdzas bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: lus snod ces bya ba la sogs pa'i lus nyid ni bdag gi snod gzhir gyur pa de las 'byung ba chen po lngar gyur pa'i rdzas bza' bar bya'o //
translated: The body itself is the vessel of the self, the basis. From that, the substances that become the five great elements should be eaten.

original: de la dus dang dus min ni zla ba nyi ma dag dang gsum pa aa wa dh'u t'i rlung la bzhi pa'i dga' bas thams cad yongs su 'joms pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dus dang dus min ni zla ba nyi ma dag dang gsum pa aa wa dh'u t'i rlung la bzhi pa'i dga' bas thams cad yongs su 'joms pa'i phyir /
translated: As for the timely and untimely, the three of the moon, sun, and the wind of the avadh≈´tƒ´ are completely destroyed by the fourth joy.

original: bza' ba dang btung ba ni rang bzhin med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba ni rang bzhin med par byed pa'o //
translated: Eating and drinking are made to be without intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin du dpal dus kyi @183a * //üîΩ'khor lo las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal dus kyi @183a * // 'khor lo las kyang /
translated: Similarly, in the glorious KƒÅlacakra,üîΩit is said:

original: gang zhig thig le dkar 'dzin lhung na nyin mtshan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zhig thig le dkar 'dzin lhung na nyin mtshan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúIf the white drop falls, it is day and night, etc.‚Äù

original: rkang pa bzhi pas 'bras bu rdzogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi pas 'bras bu rdzogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The fourth line speaks of the complete result.

original: rgya dang rdos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de la bde ba chen po'i dga' ba ni rgya zhes te dgongs pa'i skad kyi sku'i dga' ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rgya dang rdos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de la bde ba chen po'i dga' ba ni rgya zhes te dgongs pa'i skad kyi sku'i dga' ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSeal‚Äù and ‚Äústone‚Äù and so on: the joy of great bliss is the ‚Äúseal,‚Äù the conceptualization of the joy of the body in the language of intention.

original: rdos zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'i skad kyis gsung gi dga' ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o /
analyzed: rdos zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'i skad kyis gsung gi dga' ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o /
translated: ‚ÄúStone‚Äù is the conceptualization of the joy of speech in the language of intention.

original: thag pa zhes pa ni thugs kyi dga' ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: thag pa zhes pa ni thugs kyi dga' ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRope‚Äù is the conceptualization of the joy of mind.

original: de rnams thams cad gzugs la sogs pa yang nam mkha'o //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad gzugs la sogs pa yang nam mkha'o //
translated: All of them are space, form, etc.

original: brgyug pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal 'bebs pa de nyid rlung gi ngo bo lus kyi ri dags so //
analyzed: brgyug pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal 'bebs pa de nyid rlung gi ngo bo lus kyi ri dags so //
translated: The running is the descent of clear light, which is the wind-nature of the body-deer.

original: bros pa ni rang bzhin med par gyur pa rtag tu goms pa'i rnal 'byor pas nam mkhar 'od gsal la thim par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bros pa ni rang bzhin med par gyur pa rtag tu goms pa'i rnal 'byor pas nam mkhar 'od gsal la thim par gyur pa'o //
translated: The fleeing is the yogi who is always familiar with the absence of intrinsic nature, who has dissolved into space in clear light.

original: de'i phyir bhu su ku'i zhabs kyis mtshan mo zhe pa ni ma rig pa'i mun pa sangs pa ni bros pa zhes pa'i don to //üîΩde bzhin du lung las kyang /üîΩbdag nyid de bzhin thig gyur te //
analyzed: de'i phyir bhu su ku'i zhabs kyis mtshan mo zhe pa ni ma rig pa'i mun pa sangs pa ni bros pa zhes pa'i don to // de bzhin du lung las kyang / bdag nyid de bzhin thig gyur te //
translated: Therefore, the venerable Bhusuku says, The night is the darkness of ignorance, and the fleeing is the clearing of it.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni srog gi bdag / ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni srog gi bdag / ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Likewise, a scripture says, The self is the thread, and the Lord is the controller of life.

original: dpa' bo'i ti la zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs nag po spyod pa'i zhabs kyi'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i ti la zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs nag po spyod pa'i zhabs kyi'o //

original: gang tshe zla ba gang ba shar gyur pa //
analyzed: gang tshe zla ba gang ba shar gyur pa //
translated: When the full moon rises,

original: de tshe sems kyi rgyal po dri ma med //
analyzed: de tshe sems kyi rgyal po dri ma med //

original: gti mug dri ma gcod pa bla ma'i gsungs //
analyzed: gti mug dri ma gcod pa bla ma'i gsungs //

analyzed: yul dang dbang po nam mkhar sleb par 'gyur //

original: mkha' mtshungs sa bon gang zhig mkha' mnyam 'gro //
analyzed: mkha' mtshungs sa bon gang zhig mkha' mnyam 'gro //

original: rang gi shing las khams gsum grib mas khyab //
analyzed: rang gi shing las khams gsum grib mas khyab //
translated: From one's own tree, the three realms are pervaded by shade.

original: ji ltar nyin byed shar bas mtshan mo sel bar byed //
analyzed: ji ltar nyin byed shar bas mtshan mo sel bar byed //

original: srid mtshor gti mug rab rib sel bar byed //
analyzed: srid mtshor gti mug rab rib sel bar byed //

original: ji ltar dang pa'i rgyal pos chu bo 'byed //
analyzed: ji ltar dang pa'i rgyal pos chu bo 'byed //
translated: Just as the king of swans parts the river,

original: srid pa za zhes k'ahna pa yis smra //
analyzed: srid pa za zhes k'ahna pa yis smra //

original: don de nyid bde ba chen po'i rgyal po chos thams cad dmigs pa med pa'i ro de yis slar yang nag pa'o spyod pa pa rnam par sgom par byad do //
analyzed: don de nyid bde ba chen po'i rgyal po chos thams cad dmigs pa med pa'i ro de yis slar yang nag pa'o spyod pa pa rnam par sgom par byad do //
translated: That very meaning is again contemplated by the practitioner, the king of great bliss, by the taste of all phenomena being free from reference points.

original: zla ba gang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bla ma'i drin las gang gi dus su cha bcu drug dang ldan @183b pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor shar bar gyur pa de'i dus su rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug sems kyi rgyal po
analyzed: zla ba gang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bla ma'i drin las gang gi dus su cha bcu drug dang ldan @183b pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor shar bar gyur pa de'i dus su rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug sems kyi rgyal po
translated: In the full moon and so forth, by the guru's kindness, when the mandala of the moon of bodhicitta endowed with sixteen parts arises, at that time the lord of yogis, the king of minds,

analyzed: shin tu dri ma med par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dh'u'i rkang pa don de nyid brtan par byed do //

analyzed: gcod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni blo gros dang ldan pas bla ma'i gsung gis gti mug la sog pa'i sgrib pa 'bros pas 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚Äú Cutting‚Äù and so forth means that by the guru‚Äôs instruction, the wise one becomes free of the obscurations of delusion and so forth.

original: yul dang dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nam khar 'od gsal la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nam khar 'od gsal la 'jug par byed do //
translated: ‚Äú The object and sense power‚Äù and so forth means that one enters into luminosity in the sky.

original: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: In the same way, the venerable Saraha also says:

original: dus mnyam shar ba de la phyag 'tshal lo ;
analyzed: dus mnyam shar ba de la phyag 'tshal lo ;

original: ; zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ; zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

original: rkang pa gnyis pa chos kyi sa bon gyi nus pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pa chos kyi sa bon gyi nus pa gsungs te /
translated: The second line speaks of the potency of the seed of phenomena.

original: mkha' mtshungs sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i sa bon ni 'od gsal gyi rang bzhin sems las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: mkha' mtshungs sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i sa bon ni 'od gsal gyi rang bzhin sems las skyes pa ste /

original: de'i rang bzhin 'od rab tu gsal ba ni rang gi shing ljon pa'i grib ma rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug ye shes kyi 'od zer gyis 'jig rten gsum po khyab pa'o //

original: rkang pa gsum pas de'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid gsungs te /üîΩmtshan mo sel zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper na nyin mor byed pa shar bar gyur na mtshan mo mun pa sel ba bzhin du ji ltar bla ma dam pa'i zhabs kyi rdul gyi tshogs la rab tu 'dud na so sor lta ba las yang dag
analyzed: rkang pa gsum pas de'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid gsungs te / mtshan mo sel zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper na nyin mor byed pa shar bar gyur na mtshan mo mun pa sel ba bzhin du ji ltar bla ma dam pa'i zhabs kyi rdul gyi tshogs la rab tu 'dud na so sor lta ba las yang dag
translated: The third line states its special characteristic.

original: par skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi drin las srid pa'i rgya mtshor ye shes kyi gti mug dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i sgrib pa ring du 'gros par gsungs so //
analyzed: par skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi drin las srid pa'i rgya mtshor ye shes kyi gti mug dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i sgrib pa ring du 'gros par gsungs so //
translated: As it is said, Just as the sun, rising, dispels the darkness of the night, so does the yogi's intuition, arising from the guru's grace, dispel the darkness of the afflictions of the three worlds.

original: rkang pa bzhi pas rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi spyod pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi pas rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi spyod pa gsungs te /

original: ngang pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper na phyi rol du ngang pa'i rgyal pos chu dang 'o ma 'dres pa'i chu rnam par phye nas 'o ma 'thung bar byed do //

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

analyzed: ye shes byang chub pa las kyang // srid pa ma yin myang @184a * //
translated: in the J√±ƒÅnottaratantra,üîΩit says,

analyzed: 'das ma yin //
translated: Not existence, not nirvƒÅ·πáa,

analyzed: yang dag ji bzhin rtogs pa las //

original: zhes so // 'di ni thag pa'i zhabs kyi glu dbyangs so //
analyzed: zhes so // 'di ni thag pa'i zhabs kyi glu dbyangs so //
translated: This is the song of the venerable Pa·π≠a.

original: chos 'byung rkang rten rdo rje gnas kyi skad //
analyzed: chos 'byung rkang rten rdo rje gnas kyi skad //
translated: The sound of the vajra abode, the foot of the source of phenomena,

analyzed: nor bus son pa stong nyid kyis mtshon stong nyid snying //

analyzed: thag gi ro rnyed tha ga gti mug dra ba grol //

translated: The meaning of comprehending all phenomena is taught by the siddha-ƒÅcƒÅrya Tagpa for the sake of sentient beings.

analyzed: chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos 'byung dgongs pa'i skad kyis shes rab kyi chos 'byung du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The words dharma and so on should be understood in the dharma-source intention as realize in the dharma-source of wisdom.

analyzed: rkang rten zhes pa ni rkang pa bzhi dga' pa bzhi'i rten du gyur pa'o //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
