original: rdo rje zhes pa ni rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi bya ba dang byed pa'i dngos po las de'i gnas kyi skad de ni rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes pa ni rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi bya ba dang byed pa'i dngos po las de'i gnas kyi skad de ni rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The word vajra is the name of the abode of the lord of yoga, who is the agent of the action.

original: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: Thus, Saraha says:

original: rdo rje 'bebs pas g-yo ba nyid //
analyzed: rdo rje 'bebs pas g-yo ba nyid //
translated: The vajra is moved by the descent of the vajra.

original: padma yod pas rdo rje'o //
analyzed: padma yod pas rdo rje'o //
translated: The lotus is the vajra.

original: bya ba byed pas rgyas 'debs pa //
analyzed: bya ba byed pas rgyas 'debs pa //
translated: The seal is the action of the action.

original: 'di ni bde chen rgyal po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bde chen rgyal po'o //
translated: This is the king of great bliss.

original: de la shes rab kyi chu skyes la me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdag nyid rdo rje bla ma'i drin las so //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi chu skyes la me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdag nyid rdo rje bla ma'i drin las so //
translated: There, the relative bodhicitta, which is the nature of the five wisdoms such as the mirror-like wisdom, in the lotus of wisdom, is from the kindness of the vajra guru, who is the nature of emptiness and compassion.

original: dri med gos zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal gyis yongs su dag par byed do zhes so //
analyzed: dri med gos zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal gyis yongs su dag par byed do zhes so //
translated: The ‚Äústainless cloth‚Äù is purified by natural luminosity.

original: de bzhin du @184b brtag pa gnyis pa las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du @184b brtag pa gnyis pa las kyang /
translated: Similarly, the second chapter of the Guhyasamaja Tantra states:

original: kun rdzob kunda dang mtshungs pa //
analyzed: kun rdzob kunda dang mtshungs pa //
translated: The relative is like a lotus,

original: don dam bde ba'i gzugs can no //üîΩzhes so // dhr'u'i rkang pas yang dag par rtogs pa brtan par byed do //
analyzed: don dam bde ba'i gzugs can no // zhes so // dhr'u'i rkang pas yang dag par rtogs pa brtan par byed do //
translated: The ultimate is the form of bliss.

original: bdag ni thag zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi thabs kyi bdag ni tha ga pa'i zhabs so //
analyzed: bdag ni thag zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi thabs kyi bdag ni tha ga pa'i zhabs so //
translated: The half-verse beginning ‚ÄúI am the weaver‚Äù is the method of the essence. ‚Äú I‚Äù is the weaver.

original: rgyu dang sbun dag gi gang gi phyir na kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye ba dmigs pas mtshon pa dag gis mi shes so //
analyzed: rgyu dang sbun dag gi gang gi phyir na kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye ba dmigs pas mtshon pa dag gis mi shes so //
translated: ‚Äú Thread‚Äù is the relative and ultimate, which are not known by means of the divisions of relative and ultimate, which are indicated by the terms ‚Äúseed‚Äù and ‚Äúchaff.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang /
translated: Similarly, it is stated:

original: gzung 'dzin dngos po med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin dngos po med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the nonexistence of the entities of percept and perceiver,

original: sems ni gang du'ang skye ba med //
analyzed: sems ni gang du'ang skye ba med //
translated: The mind is not produced anywhere.

original: gang la sems nyid skye med pa //
analyzed: gang la sems nyid skye med pa //
translated: Where the mind itself is not produced,

original: de nyid mchog gi go 'phang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid mchog gi go 'phang ngo //
translated: That is the supreme stage.

original: rkang pa gnyis pas rten dang brtan pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pas rten dang brtan pa gsungs te /
translated: The second half-verse teaches the support and the supported.

original: phyed bcas khru gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang gi lus la bsam gtan gyi khang par grol ba ste /
analyzed: phyed bcas khru gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang gi lus la bsam gtan gyi khang par grol ba ste /
translated: The line three cubits and a half and so forth refers to liberation in the body itself as the chamber of meditative concentration.

original: de la dga' ba gsum pa bskyed pa'o//
analyzed: de la dga' ba gsum pa bskyed pa'o//
translated: There, one generates the third joy.

original: nam mkha' khengs gyur zhes pa ni yongs su dag pa'i 'od gsal gyis yongs su sbyar bar byas pas so sor lta ba dang ldan pas bdag gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' khengs gyur zhes pa ni yongs su dag pa'i 'od gsal gyis yongs su sbyar bar byas pas so sor lta ba dang ldan pas bdag gnas pa'o //
translated: The line filling the sky means that one abides in the individual view, since one is completely filled with the completely pure clear light.

original: de bzhin du brtag pa gnyis pa las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du brtag pa gnyis pa las kyang /
translated: Similarly, the second chapter of the Guhyasamaja Tantra says:

original: lus dang bral ba'i sems nyid ni //
analyzed: lus dang bral ba'i sems nyid ni //
translated: The mind itself, free from the body,

original: gzhan du spang bar bya ba med //
analyzed: gzhan du spang bar bya ba med //
translated: is not to be abandoned elsewhere.

original: ces so // rkang pa gsum pas yid ches pa'i tshogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ces so // rkang pa gsum pas yid ches pa'i tshogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The third line refers to the assembly of the faithful.

original: gzhom du med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i thags bzangs ni dgongs pa'i skad kyis srog dang rtsol ba thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyis rlung gnyis la gzhom du med pa'i sgra dang gzugs brnyan yongs su rtog pa zhes so //
analyzed: gzhom du med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i thags bzangs ni dgongs pa'i skad kyis srog dang rtsol ba thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyis rlung gnyis la gzhom du med pa'i sgra dang gzugs brnyan yongs su rtog pa zhes so //
translated: The line the sound of the indestructible and so forth refers to the two winds of method and wisdom, which are the life and exertion winds, as indicated by the code language. The two winds are imagined as the sound of the indestructible and the image.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i sgra brnyan dang // de nyid kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems bla ma dam pa'i gsung gis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i sgra brnyan dang // de nyid kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems bla ma dam pa'i gsung gis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: and that very relative awakening mind are to be accomplished by the speech of the sublime guru.

original: gnas gnyis chad gyur zhes pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med par 'dzin pa dag bcad nas rdo rje dang chu skyes yang dag par sbyor ba bstan pas mi phyed par bdag gis bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: gnas gnyis chad gyur zhes pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med par 'dzin pa dag bcad nas rdo rje dang chu skyes yang dag par sbyor ba bstan pas mi phyed par bdag gis bya'o zhes so //
translated: The line ‚Äúthe two places are cut off‚Äù indicates that having eliminated the apprehensions of entity and non-entity, one should be indivisible by teaching the correct union of the vajra and the lotus.

original: rkang pa bzhi pas rnal 'byor pa'i rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi pas rnal 'byor pa'i rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
translated: The fourth line states the praise of the yogi.

original: nor bus son pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos thams cad rang @185a * //
analyzed: nor bus son pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos thams cad rang @185a * //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving reached the jewel‚Äù and so forth.üîΩFrom the state of the natural luminosity of all phenomena, the yogi embraces the young maiden.

original: bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i khod du chud pa las dar ma'i skye bo dang 'khyud pas de nyid rang bzhin gyis yongs su gyur pa aa wa dh'u t'i rnal 'byor ma bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i khod du chud pa las dar ma'i skye bo dang 'khyud pas de nyid rang bzhin gyis yongs su gyur pa aa wa dh'u t'i rnal 'byor ma bdag med ma'o //
translated: That very natural transformation is the yogi NairƒÅtmya in the avadh≈´ti.

original: nor bur gnas zhes pa ni 'thag pa'i tshul tha ga'i zhabs bdag gis thob pa'o //
analyzed: nor bur gnas zhes pa ni 'thag pa'i tshul tha ga'i zhabs bdag gis thob pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúResiding in the jewel‚Äù is the yogi‚Äôs attainment of the state of the weaver‚Äôs foot.

original: de'i phyir de'i drin las gti mug gis mngon par 'khyud pa'i srad bus bcings pa rnam par dral bar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i drin las gti mug gis mngon par 'khyud pa'i srad bus bcings pa rnam par dral bar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, through his grace, the bonds of the rope of ignorance are unraveled.

original: thag ces pa ni skyes pa'i chos dang rnam par bral nas rdo rje 'dzin par gyur to zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thag ces pa ni skyes pa'i chos dang rnam par bral nas rdo rje 'dzin par gyur to zhes pa'o //

original: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: Similarly, Saraha, the venerable one, also said:

original: de ni dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: That is glorious, and so forth.

original: sha ba ri zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs zhi ba'i zhabs kyi'o //
analyzed: sha ba ri zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs zhi ba'i zhabs kyi'o //
translated: This is the song of Shavari, the venerable one.

original: tshad mas brtags shing brtags pa'i cha shas cha //
analyzed: tshad mas brtags shing brtags pa'i cha shas cha //
translated: The part of the investigation by means of valid cognition is the part.

original: cha shas cha shas brtags na lhag ma med //
analyzed: cha shas cha shas brtags na lhag ma med //
translated: When the part is investigated, there is no remainder.

original: de nyid phyir na gzugs ni ma rnyed do //
analyzed: de nyid phyir na gzugs ni ma rnyed do //
translated: Therefore, form is not found.

original: sh'antis smras pa ci zhig sgom par byed //
analyzed: sh'antis smras pa ci zhig sgom par byed //
translated: Shanta said, What is meditated upon?

original: tshad mas brtags brtags stong pa nyid du song //
analyzed: tshad mas brtags brtags stong pa nyid du song //

original: slar yang blangs nas rang gi 'gog par byed //
analyzed: slar yang blangs nas rang gi 'gog par byed //
translated: Having taken it up again, one stops it.

original: rnam pa gnyis 'bab lam ni ma mthong ste //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis 'bab lam ni ma mthong ste //
translated: The path of the two flowing together is not seen.

original: sh'antis smras pa skra rtse'i cha mi shong //
analyzed: sh'antis smras pa skra rtse'i cha mi shong //

original: bya ba byed pa zung dag yod ma yin //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa zung dag yod ma yin //
translated: The two, action and agent, do not exist.

original: rang gis rig pas sh'anti pa yis smras //
analyzed: rang gis rig pas sh'anti pa yis smras //
translated: ≈öƒÅntipa, who is known by self-awareness,

original: ye shes kyi dga' ba'i bde bas gang zhing brlan pa grub pa'i slob dpon sh'anti pas don de nyid skye bo rnams kyi phyir rab tu gsungs so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi dga' ba'i bde bas gang zhing brlan pa grub pa'i slob dpon sh'anti pas don de nyid skye bo rnams kyi phyir rab tu gsungs so //
translated: The master ≈öƒÅntipa, who is filled and moistened by the bliss of the joy of wisdom, has fully taught this meaning for the sake of people.

original: tul zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyis nyes pa nyid tshad mas gzhal bar rig pa ni 'jig rten gsum dang lus ngag yid kyi 'dir g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas cha shas can gcig tshad mas skyes par byas pa'i
analyzed: tul zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyis nyes pa nyid tshad mas gzhal bar rig pa ni 'jig rten gsum dang lus ngag yid kyi 'dir g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas cha shas can gcig tshad mas skyes par byas pa'i
translated: As for tull and so on, the fault of nature itself is measured by valid cognition. It is known that in the three worlds, in this body, speech, and mind, the moving and unmoving parts, and so on, are one part measured by valid cognition.

original: rang bzhin cha shas drug tu bsgrub par byas nas de nyid kyi cha shas rdul phra rab gon bu'i rdul phran cha drug tu dngos po med par phye zhing phye bas cha shas med pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin cha shas drug tu bsgrub par byas nas de nyid kyi cha shas rdul phra rab gon bu'i rdul phran cha drug tu dngos po med par phye zhing phye bas cha shas med pa'o //
translated: Having established the six parts of nature, that very part is divided into six parts of the subtle particle of the atom of Gopa, becoming non-existent. By being divided, there are no parts.

original: cha shas med pas mtshon pa de nyid kyang rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir de'i sems kyi rgyu'i phyir rjes la thob pa med do //
analyzed: cha shas med pas mtshon pa de nyid kyang rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir de'i sems kyi rgyu'i phyir rjes la thob pa med do //
translated: Since it is partless, that very indication is free from cause, and therefore there is no post-attainment because of the cause of that mind.

original: sh'anti'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: sh'anti'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa /

analyzed: dngos po de la dmigs pa dang dngos po med pa la ci zhig bsgom par bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the meditation on that thing which is the object of observation and on non-thing?‚Äù

original: de bzhin @185b du yang shes rab le'u las //
analyzed: de bzhin @185b du yang shes rab le'u las //
translated: And also in the Praj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ literature,

analyzed: rnam par dpyad byas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it says, ‚ÄúWhen analyzed . . .‚Äù and so forth.

original: rkang pa gnyis pas don de nyid brtan par byed do //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pas don de nyid brtan par byed do //

original: tshad mas brtags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de rnam par dpyod pa'i tshad mas yang cha shas la sogs pa 'byin pa'o ;
analyzed: tshad mas brtags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de rnam par dpyod pa'i tshad mas yang cha shas la sogs pa 'byin pa'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúInvestigated by valid knowledge‚Äù and so forth: when that is analyzed, valid knowledge also eliminates parts and so forth.

original: / stong pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba la sems rab tu zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: / stong pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba la sems rab tu zhugs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEmptiness‚Äù is the mind fully engaged in clear light.

original: de la bdag gis 'od gsal bzung nas 'gog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i bsgom par bya ba dang / sgom pa po'i ngo bo 'gog pa zhes so //
analyzed: de la bdag gis 'od gsal bzung nas 'gog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i bsgom par bya ba dang / sgom pa po'i ngo bo 'gog pa zhes so //
translated: In this regard, having grasped clear light, one stops and so on refers to the cessation of the nature of the object of meditation and the meditator, which are grasped as a self.

original: de bzhin du brtag pa gnyis pa las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du brtag pa gnyis pa las kyang /

original: bsgom med sgom pa po yang med //
analyzed: bsgom med sgom pa po yang med //

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

original: rkang pa gsum pas lam gyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gsum pas lam gyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /

analyzed: de bzhin du yad s'u ta ke las kyang /
translated: Similarly, the Suka Sutra also says:

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyas gdab pa //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyas gdab pa //
translated: The seal of cause and effect.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
translated: And so on.

original: / rkang pa lnga pas rdo rje bla ma'i bdag nyid che ba gsungs te /
analyzed: / rkang pa lnga pas rdo rje bla ma'i bdag nyid che ba gsungs te /
translated: The fifth line states the greatness of the vajra guru:

original: bla ma'i gsung gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bla ma dam pa'i gsung gzhur byas nas rang gi yid byang chub kyi sems kyi mda'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i gsung gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bla ma dam pa'i gsung gzhur byas nas rang gi yid byang chub kyi sems kyi mda'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe arrow of my mind‚Äù and so on. Having drawn the bow of the speech of the holy guru, the arrow of bodhicitta is shot.

original: mda' gcig nyid ni bsdogs byas nas //
analyzed: mda' gcig nyid ni bsdogs byas nas //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving aimed the single arrow‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni gnyis @188a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gnyis @188a * //
translated: means that the two

original: po dag gcig tu byas nas dbyangs gcig nges par sgrogs pas de la goms par byas par gyur pa de yis mya ngan las 'das pas sa ra ha'i zhabs bdag gis thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi skyon bcom pa'o //
analyzed: po dag gcig tu byas nas dbyangs gcig nges par sgrogs pas de la goms par byas par gyur pa de yis mya ngan las 'das pas sa ra ha'i zhabs bdag gis thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi skyon bcom pa'o //
translated: Having made the two syllables into one, he has made himself familiar with the single tone, and by that he has conquered the fault of beginningless ignorance, and has attained nirvana.

original: rkang pa drug pas sems kyi yang dag par ji lta ba'i ngo bo gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa drug pas sems kyi yang dag par ji lta ba'i ngo bo gsungs te /
translated: The sixth verse states the nature of the mind just as it is.

original: smyon pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i chang gis rab tu myos pa dag gi sems rdo rje nyid sa wa ri'o //
analyzed: smyon pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i chang gis rab tu myos pa dag gi sems rdo rje nyid sa wa ri'o //
translated: The mad and so forth are the mind-vajra of those who are intoxicated by the wine of coemergence.

original: cher khros pa zhes pa ni ye shes kyi dga' ba'i dris bskul bar gyur pa bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor padma bzhin du gyen du rab tu bskyod pa las de la nub par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: cher khros pa zhes pa ni ye shes kyi dga' ba'i dris bskul bar gyur pa bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor padma bzhin du gyen du rab tu bskyod pa las de la nub par gyur pa'o //
translated: Very angry is the upward movement of the lotus in the great-bliss wheel, which is aroused by the scent of the joy of wisdom, and it dissolves into that.

original: ri mchog ces bya ba ni gsungs pa'i don grub pa'i slob dpon bdag gis ji ltar btsal bar bya /
analyzed: ri mchog ces bya ba ni gsungs pa'i don grub pa'i slob dpon bdag gis ji ltar btsal bar bya /
translated: The best of mountains is the master who has accomplished the meaning of the teachings. How should I search for him?

original: de bzhin du lung las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du lung las kyang /
translated: Likewise, it is said in the scriptures:

original: ji srid sems ni rab 'jug pa //
analyzed: ji srid sems ni rab 'jug pa //
translated: As long as the mind is engaged,

original: bgrod pa rnams kyi mthar thug med //
analyzed: bgrod pa rnams kyi mthar thug med //
translated: there is no end to the journey.

original: sems nyid log par gyur pa la //
analyzed: sems nyid log par gyur pa la //
translated: When the mind itself is reversed,

original: bgrod bya dang ni bgrod byed med //
analyzed: bgrod bya dang ni bgrod byed med //
translated: there is neither a destination nor a traveler.

original: pa ta ha manydza ri zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs l'u yi pa'i zhabs kyi'o //
analyzed: pa ta ha manydza ri zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs l'u yi pa'i zhabs kyi'o //
translated: This is the song of Patanjali, the feet of Luipa.

original: dngos po ma yin dngos po med pa'ang ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: dngos po ma yin dngos po med pa'ang ma yin pa'i //
translated: Not a thing, not a non-thing,

original: 'di 'dra'i sangs rgyas gang gis yid ni ches par byed //
analyzed: 'di 'dra'i sangs rgyas gang gis yid ni ches par byed //
translated: who could believe in such a Buddha?

original: l'u yis smras pa rmongs pa ya mtshan mtshon du med //
analyzed: l'u yis smras pa rmongs pa ya mtshan mtshon du med //
translated: Luipa said, ‚ÄúIgnorance is amazing, indescribable.

original: khams gsum nyid du rol pa dbyibs dang spyod lam med //
analyzed: khams gsum nyid du rol pa dbyibs dang spyod lam med //
translated: Without shape or conduct, it plays in the three realms.

original: gang gi kha dog mtshan ma gzugs ni mi shes so //
analyzed: gang gi kha dog mtshan ma gzugs ni mi shes so //
translated: Its color, sign, and form are unknown.

original: de ni ji ltar lung dang rig byed dag las bshad //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar lung dang rig byed dag las bshad //
translated: How is it explained in the scriptures and the Vedas?

original: gang gis ji ltar smra ba bdag gis dri bar bya //
analyzed: gang gis ji ltar smra ba bdag gis dri bar bya //
translated: I will ask how and by whom it is spoken of.

original: chu yi zla ba ji bzhin bden dang brdzun pa'ang min //
analyzed: chu yi zla ba ji bzhin bden dang brdzun pa'ang min //
translated: Like the moon in water, it is neither true nor false.

original: l'u yis smras pa bdag gi bsgom pa ji lta bu //
analyzed: l'u yis smras pa bdag gi bsgom pa ji lta bu //
translated: Luipa said, ‚ÄúWhat is my meditation like?

original: gang zhig blangs 'dug de ni bdag gis ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang zhig blangs 'dug de ni bdag gis ma mthong ngo //
translated: I do not see what is taken up.

original: ye shes kyi dga' bas brjid pa'i l'u yi zhabs kyis de kho na nyid kyi don khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir gsungs te /üîΩdngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po de nyid de kho na nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi dga' bas brjid pa'i l'u yi zhabs kyis de kho na nyid kyi don khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir gsungs te / dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po de nyid de kho na nyid ma yin no //
translated: The venerable Luipa, resplendent with the joy of knowledge, says that the meaning of reality is especially exalted:üîΩThings, etc.

original: gang gi phyir na ril por 'dzin pa'i dbye ba med pa la rnam par dpyod pas dngos por dmigs pa med de ci ste dngos por thob @188b par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gi phyir na ril por 'dzin pa'i dbye ba med pa la rnam par dpyod pas dngos por dmigs pa med de ci ste dngos por thob @188b par 'gyur //
translated: That thing itself is not reality, because, when analyzed, there is no apprehension of a thing, since there is no division of a unitary thing. How could a thing be obtained?

original: dngos po med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it a non-thing, because it is not a real entity.

original: bden pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i phyir 'di 'dra ba'i rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sems can gang gis kyang de nyid yid ches par byed ces so //
analyzed: bden pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i phyir 'di 'dra ba'i rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sems can gang gis kyang de nyid yid ches par byed ces so //
translated: Thus, even a perfect Buddha cannot convince anyone of that reality.

original: dhr'u'i rkang pas ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin thob par dka' ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dhr'u'i rkang pas ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin thob par dka' ba gsungs te /
translated: Dharukalpa says that the attainment of the nature of reality is difficult:

original: l'u yis smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i grub pa'i slob dpon l'u yi ba'i zhabs nyid kyis te /
analyzed: l'u yis smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i grub pa'i slob dpon l'u yi ba'i zhabs nyid kyis te /
translated: The venerable Luipa himself, the accomplished master, said, The three realms are the play of the three, body, speech, and mind.

original: 'di nyid mtshon par dka' ba'i de nyid byis pa'i rnal 'byor pas mtshon mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid mtshon par dka' ba'i de nyid byis pa'i rnal 'byor pas mtshon mi nus pa'o //
translated: This reality is difficult to illustrate, and cannot be illustrated by a child-like yogi.

original: gang gi phyir khams gsum ni lus ngag yid gsum rnam par rol pa ni rtse bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khams gsum ni lus ngag yid gsum rnam par rol pa ni rtse bar byed pa'o //
translated: Because the three realms are the play of the three, body, speech, and mind.

original: de'i rgyud la ring po dang thung du dang zlum po la sogs pa dbyibs mi shes pas gang du nges par gnas par byed ces pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyud la ring po dang thung du dang zlum po la sogs pa dbyibs mi shes pas gang du nges par gnas par byed ces pa'o //
translated: Since he does not know the shapes of long, short, round, and so on, where does he abide?

original: rkang pa gnyis pas gsungs pa'i don de nyid gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pas gsungs pa'i don de nyid gsal bar byed do //
translated: The second line clarifies the meaning of the first.

original: gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi de nyid kyi mtshan ma'i gzugs rtogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi de nyid kyi mtshan ma'i gzugs rtogs pa med pa ste /
translated: The one who, etc. means the one who does not understand the form of the sign of that reality.

original: de yang ji ltar sna tshogs pa'i snyan dngags dang / 'dul ba dang lung dang bstan bcos dang rig byed rnams kyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar sna tshogs pa'i snyan dngags dang / 'dul ba dang lung dang bstan bcos dang rig byed rnams kyis bshad pa'o //
translated: And that is explained by various kinds of poetry, vinaya, sutra, treatises, and the Vedas.

original: de bzhin du klu sgrub zhabs kyis kyang /üîΩdmar po ma yin ser po dang // btsod kha'i kha dog de mi dmigs //
analyzed: de bzhin du klu sgrub zhabs kyis kyang / dmar po ma yin ser po dang // btsod kha'i kha dog de mi dmigs //
translated: Likewise, the venerable Nagarjuna also says:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is not red, nor is it yellow, nor is it the color of vermillion.

original: rkang pa gsum pas de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gsum pas de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin gsungs te /
translated: The third line states the nature of reality:

original: gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gis ci zhig grol te so so'i skye bo'i phyir bar gyi grub mtha' ci zhig sbyin par bya /
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gis ci zhig grol te so so'i skye bo'i phyir bar gyi grub mtha' ci zhig sbyin par bya /
translated: By what is anyone liberated? What intermediate philosophy is to be given to the worldling?

original: ji ltar chu zla bden pa yang ma yin mi bden pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar chu zla bden pa yang ma yin mi bden pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Just as the reflection of the moon in water is neither true nor false.

original: de nyid rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug sgom pa'i grong khyer gyi gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: de nyid rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug sgom pa'i grong khyer gyi gzugs brnyan no //
translated: That is the reflection of the city of the yogi's meditation.

original: de ji ltar sbyar te bshad par bya /
analyzed: de ji ltar sbyar te bshad par bya /
translated: How is it to be applied? How is it to be explained?

original: yang na de la ji ltar yid ches par byed de smrar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na de la ji ltar yid ches par byed de smrar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, how is one to have confidence in it? Because it is inexpressible.

original: rkang pa bzhi pas sems kyi ngo bo gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi pas sems kyi ngo bo gsungs te /
translated: The fourth line states the nature of mind:

original: l'u yis smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni l'u yi pa'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: l'u yis smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni l'u yi pa'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa ste /
translated: Luu says, etc.

original: bdag gis bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa po dang sgom pa rnams ngo bo med pas ci zhig bsgom par bya /üîΩde'i @189a * //
analyzed: bdag gis bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa po dang sgom pa rnams ngo bo med pas ci zhig bsgom par bya / de'i @189a * //
translated: What is to be meditated upon, the meditator, and the meditation are devoid of essence. What is to be meditated upon?

original: phyir rkang pa bzhi pa bzung nas bdag gnas pa ste /
analyzed: phyir rkang pa bzhi pa bzung nas bdag gnas pa ste /
translated: Therefore, having taken up the fourth line, ‚ÄúI abide,‚Äù

original: de yang bla ma'i gsung gis rnam par dpyad nas de'i dbyibs mngon du bstan pa med de ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de yang bla ma'i gsung gis rnam par dpyad nas de'i dbyibs mngon du bstan pa med de ma mthong ba'o //
translated: and having analyzed with the speech of the guru, the shape of that is not manifest, not seen.

original: de bzhin du yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang /
translated: And also:

original: sems ni nges par rtogs pa yis //
analyzed: sems ni nges par rtogs pa yis //
translated: By ascertaining the mind,

original: gang gi tshe na goms byed pa //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na goms byed pa //
translated: when one is habituated,

original: de tshe sems ni ngas ma mthong //
analyzed: de tshe sems ni ngas ma mthong //
translated: at that time the mind is not seen by me.

original: gang du song zhing gang nas 'gyur //
analyzed: gang du song zhing gang nas 'gyur //
translated: Where did it go? From where did it come?

original: mal la re zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs bhu su ku'i zhabs kyi'o //
analyzed: mal la re zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs bhu su ku'i zhabs kyi'o //
translated: This is the song of the bed, by the feet of Bhusuku.

original: snying rje'i sprin ni rgyun mi 'chad par 'phro //
analyzed: snying rje'i sprin ni rgyun mi 'chad par 'phro //
translated: The cloud of compassion is uninterruptedly spread.

original: dngos po dngos med rtog cing rtog cing sel //
analyzed: dngos po dngos med rtog cing rtog cing sel //
translated: Things and nonthings are imagined and imagined and eliminated.

original: ya mtshan che ba nam mkha'i mthil du shar //
analyzed: ya mtshan che ba nam mkha'i mthil du shar //
translated: The great wonder arises in the middle of space.

original: lhan skyes rang bzhin ltos shig bhu su ku //
analyzed: lhan skyes rang bzhin ltos shig bhu su ku //
translated: Look at the coemergent nature, Bhusuku.

original: gang gi yid la mig 'phrul chad gyur pa //
analyzed: gang gi yid la mig 'phrul chad gyur pa //
translated: For whom the illusion is cut off in the mind,

original: rang gi yid la dga' ba ster bar byed //
analyzed: rang gi yid la dga' ba ster bar byed //
translated: It bestows delight to one's mind.

original: yul ni rnam dag bdag gi dga' ba rtogs //
analyzed: yul ni rnam dag bdag gi dga' ba rtogs //
translated: The object is the realization of one's own delight,

original: nam mkha'i mthil du ji ltar zla ba shar //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mthil du ji ltar zla ba shar //
translated: Just as the moon rises in the sky.

original: der ni khams gsum po ni rnam par brkyang //
analyzed: der ni khams gsum po ni rnam par brkyang //
translated: There, the three realms are stretched out,

original: gang shar bhu su ku yi mun pa sel //
analyzed: gang shar bhu su ku yi mun pa sel //
translated: Where the rising Bh≈´·π£uKu dispels darkness.

original: de kho na nyid kyi don bde ba chen po'i dga' bas rab tu tshim pa'i 'du shes gsum pa'i zhabs kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi don bde ba chen po'i dga' bas rab tu tshim pa'i 'du shes gsum pa'i zhabs kyis gsungs so //
translated: The third line states the perception of being completely satisfied by the delight of great bliss, which is the meaning of reality.

original: snying rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med par gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa sel ba ste rang bzhin med par byas nas yongs su dag pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi bla ma'i drin las 'phro
analyzed: snying rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med par gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa sel ba ste rang bzhin med par byas nas yongs su dag pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi bla ma'i drin las 'phro
translated: Compassion and so on dispels the concepts of grasping at things and non-things, and having made them essenceless, the completely pure Enjoyment Body arises through the kindness of the guru of the Lord of Yogis.

original: ba'o // de'i phyir bhr'u'i rkang pas de'i mthu gsungs te /
analyzed: ba'o // de'i phyir bhr'u'i rkang pas de'i mthu gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the Bharuk verse speaks of its power.

original: shar ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa de las de kho na nyid rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: shar ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa de las de kho na nyid rtogs pa ste /
translated: Rising and so on means realizing reality from that.

original: 'od gsal ya mtshan che ba zung 'jug gi 'bras bu shar bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ya mtshan che ba zung 'jug gi 'bras bu shar bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The wondrous clear light, the result of union, has arisen.

original: de'i phyir kye'i rnal 'byor pa 'du shes gsum pa'i zhabs bla ma'i drin las dga' ba gsum pa la lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin ltos shig ni shes par gyis shig pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir kye'i rnal 'byor pa 'du shes gsum pa'i zhabs bla ma'i drin las dga' ba gsum pa la lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin ltos shig ni shes par gyis shig pa ste /
translated: Therefore, O yogi, by the grace of the guru, the third stage of the three perceptions, the third joy, which is the nature of innate joy, look, i.e., understand.

original: bdag nyid la rang gis 'bod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid la rang gis 'bod par byed pa'o //
translated: It is oneself that is addressed.

original: rkang pa gnyis pas de'i mthu ston par byed de //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pas de'i mthu ston par byed de //
translated: The second line shows its power.

original: gang zhig zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba so sor blta bas mig 'phrul ni @189b dbang po'i tshogs chad cing med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba so sor blta bas mig 'phrul ni @189b dbang po'i tshogs chad cing med par byed pa'o //
translated: By the vision of that innate joy, the magic show, i.e., the collection of sense organs, is cut off and made non-existent.

original: de bzhin du sa ra ha ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa ra ha ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: Similarly, Saraha says:

original: gang du dbang po thim gyur pa //
analyzed: gang du dbang po thim gyur pa //
translated: Where the sense organs dissolve

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so forth.

original: rang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'byung bas rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnam pas rang gi yid byang chub kyi sems rdo rje bla ma'i drin gyis lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ster bar byed do //
analyzed: rang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'byung bas rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnam pas rang gi yid byang chub kyi sems rdo rje bla ma'i drin gyis lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ster bar byed do //
translated: One's and so forth refers to the non-conceptual aspect of the elements, which gives the co-emergent joy of one's mind, the mind of enlightenment, through the kindness of the guru-vajra.

original: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: Similarly, Saraha also says:

original: sems dang sems med yongs sdud pa //
analyzed: sems dang sems med yongs sdud pa //
translated: The mind and the mindless are completely included.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so forth.

original: rkang pa gsum pas lam gyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gsum pas lam gyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
translated: The third line praises the path.

original: yul ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper na zla bas nam mkha' 'od gsal bar byed do //üîΩde bzhin du bdag gi yul rnams kyi rnam par dag pa las so //
analyzed: yul ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper na zla bas nam mkha' 'od gsal bar byed do // de bzhin du bdag gi yul rnams kyi rnam par dag pa las so //
translated: The object and so forth means that, for example, the moon illuminates the sky.

original: dga' ba zhes pa ni khyad par gyi dga' ba dang mchog dga' khong du chud pas lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i zla bas gti mug gi mun pa 'joms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes pa ni khyad par gyi dga' ba dang mchog dga' khong du chud pas lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i zla bas gti mug gi mun pa 'joms par byed pa'o //
translated: Similarly, from the purification of my objects means that the moon of co-emergent joy, which is the realization of special joy and supreme joy, destroys the darkness of delusion.

original: rkang pa bzhi pas 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir de'i mthu gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi pas 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir de'i mthu gsungs te /
translated: The fourth line states the power of that, in order to attain the result.

original: der ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de la 'jig rten gsum du dga' ba bzhi dang bral na thabs gzhan med pa'o //
analyzed: der ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de la 'jig rten gsum du dga' ba bzhi dang bral na thabs gzhan med pa'o //
translated: There and so on. There, if one is separated from the four joys in the three worlds, there is no other method.

original: gang zhig shar bas grub pa'i slob dpon 'du shes gsum pa'i zhabs kyis nyon mongs pa'i mun pa bsal ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig shar bas grub pa'i slob dpon 'du shes gsum pa'i zhabs kyis nyon mongs pa'i mun pa bsal ba'o //
translated: The master of adepts, Vibhuticandra, whose feet were worshipped by the three worlds, dispelled the darkness of the afflictions.

original: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: Similarly, the venerable Saraha said:

original: gang shar de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gang shar de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to him who arose,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: pa da ha manydza ri zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyi'o //
analyzed: pa da ha manydza ri zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyi'o //
translated: The song called Padmanartana is by the venerable Aryadeva.

original: gang la yid dang dbang po rlung rnams zhugs gyur na //
analyzed: gang la yid dang dbang po rlung rnams zhugs gyur na //
translated: When the mind, the sense faculties, and the winds enter there,

original: bdag gis mi shes gang du song dang gang du sleb //
analyzed: bdag gis mi shes gang du song dang gang du sleb //
translated: I do not know where they go or where they arrive.

original: ya mtshan snying rje da ma ru nyid sgrogs par byed //
analyzed: ya mtshan snying rje da ma ru nyid sgrogs par byed //
translated: The wondrous compassion itself proclaims.

original: 'phags pa lha ni dmigs pa med la rnam par mdzes //
analyzed: 'phags pa lha ni dmigs pa med la rnam par mdzes //
translated: The venerable Aryadeva is beautiful in the absence of reference.

original: zla ba zla ba'i 'od zer ji bzhin yongs su shes //
analyzed: zla ba zla ba'i 'od zer ji bzhin yongs su shes //
translated: One should understand it completely, just like the light of the moon.

original: sems kyi rnam 'gyur de la 'phangs nas yongs su zhugs //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam 'gyur de la 'phangs nas yongs su zhugs //
translated: Having cast off the fluctuations of the mind, one should enter into it.

original: spangs gyur srid pa'i skyug bro 'jig rten spyod pa rnams //
analyzed: spangs gyur srid pa'i skyug bro 'jig rten spyod pa rnams //
translated: Having abandoned the world, which is like vomit, one should observe the conduct of the world.

original: blta zhing lta bas stong pa nyid la rnam par dpyad //
analyzed: blta zhing lta bas stong pa nyid la rnam par dpyad //
translated: By looking and looking, one should analyze emptiness.

original: 'phags pa lha ni kun la rnam par spyod @190a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa lha ni kun la rnam par spyod @190a * //
translated: ƒÄryadeva engages in all things;

original: par byed // 'jigs pa dang ni skyug phro ring du zad par byas //
analyzed: par byed // 'jigs pa dang ni skyug phro ring du zad par byas //
translated: he has eliminated fear and disgust.

original: de kho na nyid kyi don gyis rab tu dgyes pa'i 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi don gyis rab tu dgyes pa'i 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis gsungs te /
translated: This is the statement of the venerable ƒÄryadeva, who is delighted by the meaning of reality.

original: gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang du 'od gsal dkyil 'khor la sogs pa sdud pa'i rim pas yul dang rlung dang dbang po la sogs pa rang bzhin med par gyur pa de la rab tu zhugs par gyur na /
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang du 'od gsal dkyil 'khor la sogs pa sdud pa'i rim pas yul dang rlung dang dbang po la sogs pa rang bzhin med par gyur pa de la rab tu zhugs par gyur na /
translated: ‚ÄúIn whatever‚Äù and so on. In whatever place the ma·πá·∏çala of luminosity and so on are gathered by the stage of dissolution, the objects, vƒÅyus, sense organs, and so on become devoid of intrinsic existence.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyal po mtshon pa yang mi shes shing gang du song ba nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyal po mtshon pa yang mi shes shing gang du song ba nyid kyang ngo //
translated: The I is the king of the mind, which is not known to be the indicator, and it is not known where it goes.

original: dhr'u'i rkang pas dga' ba brtan par byed do //
analyzed: dhr'u'i rkang pas dga' ba brtan par byed do //
translated: The line dhruva stabilizes the joy.

original: ya mtshan zhes pa ni rmad du byung ba'i snying rje zhes te kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems bla ma'i drin las /
analyzed: ya mtshan zhes pa ni rmad du byung ba'i snying rje zhes te kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems bla ma'i drin las /
translated: Wonder is the compassion of the marvelous, which is the relative awakening mind through the kindness of the guru.

original: da ma ru zhes pa ni gzhom du med pa'i sgrar byed pa ste /
analyzed: da ma ru zhes pa ni gzhom du med pa'i sgrar byed pa ste /
translated: Damaru is taken to be the sound of the indestructible.

original: gzhom du med pa'i sgra'i ye shes rnam par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhom du med pa'i sgra'i ye shes rnam par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The gnosis of the indestructible sound is the realization.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa lha'i zhabs dmigs pa med pa chos thams cad mi dmigs pa la rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gis mdzes shing brjid pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa lha'i zhabs dmigs pa med pa chos thams cad mi dmigs pa la rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gis mdzes shing brjid pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the noble lord's feet are beautiful and majestic in the yoga of the nonobservation of all phenomena, which is the nonobservation of the object.

original: rkang pa gnyis pas yul gyi rang bzhin gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pas yul gyi rang bzhin gsungs te /
translated: The second line states the nature of the object.

original: zla ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper na zla ba nub pa na der zla ba'i 'od zer yang de la nub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: zla ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper na zla ba nub pa na der zla ba'i 'od zer yang de la nub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Moon and so on: For example, when the moon sets, the moon's light sets there as well.

original: ; rnam 'gyur zhes pa ni de bzhin du sems kyi rgyal po yang gang gi tshe sems med pa 'od gsal la thim par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ; rnam 'gyur zhes pa ni de bzhin du sems kyi rgyal po yang gang gi tshe sems med pa 'od gsal la thim par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTransformation‚Äù means that in the same way, when the king of minds dissolves into the clear light, which is without mind,

original: de'i tshe de'i rnam par rtog pa thim zhing /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i rnam par rtog pa thim zhing /
translated: then its conceptualization dissolves,

original: de la nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: and it sets.

original: de bzhin du lung las kyang /üîΩzla ba nub par gyur pa ji bzhin du //
analyzed: de bzhin du lung las kyang / zla ba nub par gyur pa ji bzhin du //
translated: In the same way, a scripture also says:üîΩJust as the moon sets,

original: chu yi zla ba ji snyed nub par 'gyur //
analyzed: chu yi zla ba ji snyed nub par 'gyur //
translated: so the moon in water sets.

original: de bzhin sems kyang lhan skyes la ni nub //
analyzed: de bzhin sems kyang lhan skyes la ni nub //
translated: In the same way, mind also sets in the innate,

original: de bzhin rnam par rtog pa kun kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin rnam par rtog pa kun kyang ngo //
translated: and so do all conceptualizations.

original: rkang pa gsum pas dngos po cha shas med pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gsum pas dngos po cha shas med pa gsungs te /
translated: The third line speaks of a partless entity:

original: spangs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa de'i phyir grub pa'i slob dpon bdag gis 'jigs pa dang ngo tsha ba la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi spyod pa yongs su spangs nas bla ma'i gsung gi lam gyis stong pa nyid la nges par lta ba'o //
analyzed: spangs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa de'i phyir grub pa'i slob dpon bdag gis 'jigs pa dang ngo tsha ba la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi spyod pa yongs su spangs nas bla ma'i gsung gi lam gyis stong pa nyid la nges par lta ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving abandoned,‚Äù and so on. Therefore, the master of reasoning, having abandoned fear, shame, and so on, worldly conduct, definitely sees emptiness by the path of the guru‚Äôs speech.

original: dngos po ni bdag med pa'i gzugs la lta ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni bdag med pa'i gzugs la lta ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEntity‚Äù is seeing the form of selflessness.

original: rkang pa bzhi pas bdag nyid kyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi pas bdag nyid kyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
translated: The fourth line states the praise of the self.

original: @190b 'phags pa lha zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis bla ma dam pa'i drin las bdag med pa'i chos thams cad mngon sum du mdzad nas 'khor ba'i skyon thams cad sun phyung nas 'bras bu med par mdzad do zhes so //
analyzed: @190b 'phags pa lha zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis bla ma dam pa'i drin las bdag med pa'i chos thams cad mngon sum du mdzad nas 'khor ba'i skyon thams cad sun phyung nas 'bras bu med par mdzad do zhes so //
translated: The noble one, the noble NƒÅgƒÅrjuna, having made manifest all dharmas that are without self through the kindness of the holy guru, has refuted all the faults of cyclic existence and made them nonexistent.

original: de sha kha zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs sa ra ha'i zhabs kyi'o //
analyzed: de sha kha zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs sa ra ha'i zhabs kyi'o //
translated: This is the song of the one called Deer, by the venerable Saraha.

original: n'a da thig le nyi zla'i dkyil 'khor med //
analyzed: n'a da thig le nyi zla'i dkyil 'khor med //
translated: The nƒÅ·∏çƒ´ has no mandala of the sun and moon.

original: sems kyi rgyal po ngo bo nyid kyis grol //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyal po ngo bo nyid kyis grol //
translated: The king of minds is liberated by its very nature.üîΩDo not abandon the straight path and take up another;

original: drang po'i lam spangs gzhan ni ma len cig / byang chub nye'o ring du ma 'gro re //
analyzed: drang po'i lam spangs gzhan ni ma len cig / byang chub nye'o ring du ma 'gro re //
translated: Do not go far, enlightenment is near.

original: lag gdub lta la me long ma len cig //
analyzed: lag gdub lta la me long ma len cig //
translated: Do not take up a mirror to look at your bracelet;

original: bdag gis bdag nyid nges par shes pas so //üîΩpha rol chu rol 'gro ba de yis so //
analyzed: bdag gis bdag nyid nges par shes pas so // pha rol chu rol 'gro ba de yis so //
translated: you know yourself by yourself.üîΩThe one who goes to the other side of the river

original: sdug pa'i skye bo dang 'grogs 'chi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug pa'i skye bo dang 'grogs 'chi bar 'gyur //
translated: dies while in the company of loved ones.

original: gang gi g-yas g-yon dag ni dong dang g-yang //
analyzed: gang gi g-yas g-yon dag ni dong dang g-yang //
translated: On the right and left are the pit and the precipice.

original: sa ra has smras drang po'i lam mo kye /
analyzed: sa ra has smras drang po'i lam mo kye /
translated: Saraha says: The path of the straight.

original: de kho na nyid kyi don chos thams cad khong du chud pa grub pa'i slob dpon sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis skye bo rnams kyi phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi don chos thams cad khong du chud pa grub pa'i slob dpon sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis skye bo rnams kyi phyir gsungs so //
translated: The venerable master Saraha, who has realized the meaning of reality, has spoken this for the sake of people.

original: n'a da zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bla ma dam pa'i gsung gi bdud rtsi'i rlabs kyis mthus don dam pa rig pa sems kyi rin po che n'a da dang thig le la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su spangs pa'i rang bzhin gyis yongs su
analyzed: n'a da zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bla ma dam pa'i gsung gi bdud rtsi'i rlabs kyis mthus don dam pa rig pa sems kyi rin po che n'a da dang thig le la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su spangs pa'i rang bzhin gyis yongs su
translated: By the wave of the nectar of the speech of the holy guru, the mind-jewel, which is the knowledge of the ultimate, is completely liberated by the nature of the abandonment of the concepts of nƒÅ·∏çƒ´, bindu, and so on.

original: grol ba ni thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i shes pa'i rab rib las so //
analyzed: grol ba ni thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i shes pa'i rab rib las so //
translated: It is liberated from the cataract of the consciousness of beginningless ignorance.

original: slar yang gzhan gyi ngo bo blta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slar yang gzhan gyi ngo bo blta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Again, in order to see the nature of another,

original: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: in the same way, the venerable Saraha says:

original: aa ho shin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: aa ho shin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúAh! Very wonderful!‚Äù and so on.

original: dh'u'i rkang pas lam gyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dh'u'i rkang pas lam gyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
translated: The first half of the verse praises the path of Avadhuti.

original: drang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ni de'i phyir aa wa dh'u'i t'i'i lam rnam par spangs nas rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi thabs gzhan med pa'o //
analyzed: drang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ni de'i phyir aa wa dh'u'i t'i'i lam rnam par spangs nas rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi thabs gzhan med pa'o //
translated: The word straight and so forth means that, having abandoned the path of Avadhuti, there is no other means of the Lord of Yogis.

original: de yis 'gro na byang chub rgyal po'i pho brang nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de yis 'gro na byang chub rgyal po'i pho brang nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: If one goes by that, then the palace of the king of enlightenment is nearby.

original: de ni yang dag par bod pa'o ;
analyzed: de ni yang dag par bod pa'o ;
translated: That is the correct explanation.

original: / kye byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa lam kyog po la lhung bas slar yang 'khor ba'i srid pa ma len cig pa'o //
analyzed: / kye byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa lam kyog po la lhung bas slar yang 'khor ba'i srid pa ma len cig pa'o //
translated: O childish yogi, do not again take up the existence of cyclic existence by falling onto a crooked path!

original: rkang pa gnyis pas rang gi rkyen nyid du byed pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pas rang gi rkyen nyid du byed pa gsungs so //
translated: The second half of the verse states that one should make it one's own condition.

original: lag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lag pa'i gdu bu la me long gis ci zhig byed pa ste /üîΩkye byi @191a * //
analyzed: lag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lag pa'i gdu bu la me long gis ci zhig byed pa ste / kye byi @191a * //
translated: The words hand and so forth mean what is the use of a mirror on the wrist?

original: pa'i rnal 'byor pa khyed kyis so //
analyzed: pa'i rnal 'byor pa khyed kyis so //
translated: O childish yogi, you!

original: rang gis de nyid rdo rje bla ma'i drin las rang gi yid kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gis de nyid rdo rje bla ma'i drin las rang gi yid kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you yourself, through the kindness of the vajra master, will know the nature of the mind of enlightenment.

original: de lta bas na khyod bla na med pa'i chos nyid mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: de lta bas na khyod bla na med pa'i chos nyid mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: Therefore, you will realize the unsurpassed reality.

original: rkang pa gsum pas byang chub kyi sems kyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gsum pas byang chub kyi sems kyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
translated: The third line states the praise of the mind of enlightenment.

original: pha rol tshu rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni pha rol don dam pa de kho na nyid byang chub kyi sems mchog gi rnal 'byor pas rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol tshu rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni pha rol don dam pa de kho na nyid byang chub kyi sems mchog gi rnal 'byor pas rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The other side, this side, etc. means that the other side, the ultimate reality, the supreme mind of enlightenment, will be realized by the yogin.

original: de'i rjes su de bla ma'i drin las phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'khor ba'i srid par de so so'i skye bos khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su de bla ma'i drin las phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'khor ba'i srid par de so so'i skye bos khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, through the kindness of the guru, he will attain the Great Seal, and therefore, in the existence of cyclic existence, he will be understood by ordinary beings.

original: de bas na gti mug la sogs pa gdug pa'i skye bo dang 'grogs na 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor bying bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na gti mug la sogs pa gdug pa'i skye bo dang 'grogs na 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor bying bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when one associates with evil people such as the ignorant, one will sink into the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: rkang pa bzhi pas slar yang lam gyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi pas slar yang lam gyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
translated: The fourth line again praises the path.

original: g-yas g-yon zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: g-yas g-yon zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The words right and left and so forth are easy to understand.

original: de'i phyir sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: Therefore, Saraha says:

original: bde ba chen po'i grong khyer du ni bgrod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i grong khyer du ni bgrod pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to reach the city of great bliss,

original: kun spangs lam bzhin 'bras bzang ma yor gyis //
analyzed: kun spangs lam bzhin 'bras bzang ma yor gyis //
translated: Do not abandon the path, as if the good fruit were not deceptive.

original: de bzhin du glu dbyangs gzhan las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du glu dbyangs gzhan las kyang /
translated: Similarly, in another song:

original: khra las 'gag dang shog ma med pa yis //
analyzed: khra las 'gag dang shog ma med pa yis //
translated: With no wings and no wings,

original: mig gis mthong ba'i lam la 'gro bar gyis //
analyzed: mig gis mthong ba'i lam la 'gro bar gyis //
translated: Go on the path seen by the eyes.

original: pa da ha manydza ri zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs te na te na pa'i zhabs kyi'o //
analyzed: pa da ha manydza ri zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs te na te na pa'i zhabs kyi'o //
translated: This is the song called The Song of Padmanairita by the venerable Tentenpa.

original: grong khyer dbus na bdag gi khyim ste khyim tshes med //
analyzed: grong khyer dbus na bdag gi khyim ste khyim tshes med //
translated: In the middle of the city is my house, without a door.

original: khru ba la ni zan med rtag tu 'dri ma par byed //üîΩspal pa yis ni sbrul nyid 'ded pa nyid du byed //
analyzed: khru ba la ni zan med rtag tu 'dri ma par byed // spal pa yis ni sbrul nyid 'ded pa nyid du byed //
translated: In the courtyard there is no food, but it is always cleaned.üîΩThe lizards chase away the snakes.

original: 'o ma bzhos pas nu ma la ni zhugs par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'o ma bzhos pas nu ma la ni zhugs par 'gyur //
translated: The calves suckle at the udders.

original: glang ni skyes gyur pa ni mo gsham la //
analyzed: glang ni skyes gyur pa ni mo gsham la //
translated: The bull is born from the barren woman.

original: 'bri ni 'jo bar byed de thun mtshams gsum //
analyzed: 'bri ni 'jo bar byed de thun mtshams gsum //
translated: The cow is milked in the three junctions.

original: gang de blo ldan de ni blo med pa //
analyzed: gang de blo ldan de ni blo med pa //
translated: The wise one is the unwise one.

original: gang de chom po de ni mkhar srungs so //
analyzed: gang de chom po de ni mkhar srungs so //
translated: The thief is the protector of the house.

original: rtag tu che sbyangs seng ge mnyam du 'dzin //
analyzed: rtag tu che sbyangs seng ge mnyam du 'dzin //
translated: The lion is always held in check by the elephant.

original: te na te na zhabs kyi glu ni sus kyang go ba nyung //
analyzed: te na te na zhabs kyi glu ni sus kyang go ba nyung //
translated: The song of Tenten's feet is understood by few.

original: don de nyid mchog tu dga' ba'i tshogs kyis tshim pa'i grub pa'i slob dpon te na te nas dgongs pa'i skad kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: don de nyid mchog tu dga' ba'i tshogs kyis tshim pa'i grub pa'i slob dpon te na te nas dgongs pa'i skad kyis gsungs te /
translated: That very meaning is expressed in the language of the intention of the accomplished master Tenten, who is satisfied by the assembly of supreme joy.

original: grong khyer dbus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni d'a zhes pa ni d'a ma la mi bden pa'i @191b gzugs te lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi gsum gyi drug cu lhag pa'i brgya rang bzhin gyi nyes pa gang du bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo la
analyzed: grong khyer dbus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni d'a zhes pa ni d'a ma la mi bden pa'i @191b gzugs te lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi gsum gyi drug cu lhag pa'i brgya rang bzhin gyi nyes pa gang du bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo la
translated: The city in the middle and so on refers to the syllable da, which is the false form of Dama, where the one hundred and sixty natural faults of the three [natures] of body, speech, and mind are in the great bliss cakra in the secret place.

original: thim par gyur pa de nyid bdag gi khyim tshes su gnas pa zla ba nyi ma nyid rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pas de nyid la thim par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: thim par gyur pa de nyid bdag gi khyim tshes su gnas pa zla ba nyi ma nyid rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pas de nyid la thim par gyur pa'o //
translated: That very [moon] dissolves into that [sun], which is the abode of the self, the moon and sun themselves, by the stage of vajra repetition.

original: phru ba zhes pa ni lus kyi gzhil /
analyzed: phru ba zhes pa ni lus kyi gzhil /
translated: The pot is the basis of the body.

original: zan ni de'i kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo bla ma'i drin gyis de la de'i dmigs pa yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zan ni de'i kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo bla ma'i drin gyis de la de'i dmigs pa yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The food is the relative awakening mind, the essence of consciousness, which, by the kindness of the guru, is not an object of that [consciousness].

original: de'i phyir bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid yis rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug rtag tu rgyun me 'chad par zhugs nas yang dang yang du sems la rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid yis rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug rtag tu rgyun me 'chad par zhugs nas yang dang yang du sems la rtog par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the lord of yogins, by the nature of selflessness, always and uninterruptedly enters and repeatedly contemplates the mind.

original: dhr'u'i rkang pa so don de nyid brtan par byed do //
analyzed: dhr'u'i rkang pa so don de nyid brtan par byed do //

analyzed: de nyid rlung gi ngo bo de yis yan lag dang bral ba'i 'od gsal gyis rnam par shes pa'i rlung gis bskul ba'o //

translated: ‚ÄúHaving milked the cow‚Äù is the union with the karmamudrƒÅ, because the bodhicitta at the tip of the vajra goes to the breast of the lady of yoga, that is, to the cakra of great bliss.

original: // ci ste ngo mtshar ba zhes so //
analyzed: // ci ste ngo mtshar ba zhes so //

analyzed: ba zhes pa ni rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi khyim du mo gsham bdag med ma de la dbang du byed pa'o //

analyzed: 'bri ni rang gi rdo rje'i rtse mor bla ma'i drin las de'i snang ba'i skyon gnyis 'jo ba zhes pa ni rang bzhin med pa'i bya bar byed pa'o //

analyzed: thun mtshams gsum zhes pa ni nyin dang mtshan du rnal 'byor pas zhes so //

original: rkang pa gsum pas rang bzhin yongs su 'jal ba gsungs te /

original: gang de blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi blo gang yin pa de rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang de blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi blo gang yin pa de rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: That which is called ‚Äúmind‚Äù and so on. The mind of the childish yogis is conceptual cognition.

analyzed: de don dam pa rig pa rnams kyis so sor bla ma'i drin las dmigs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //

original: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /

analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir na yang gang de nyid sems kyi rgyal po ni chom po ste ma byin par len par byed do //

analyzed: de nyid kyis dngos po rnam par spyod pa dang ldan par gyur pa de'i mi mthun phyogs don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid do //

original: de'i phyir byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bsgrub par dka' ba don dam pa'i bden pa sdug bsngal de sdug bsngal gyis bsgrub pa zhes so ;

analyzed: ; rkang pa bzhi pas rang bzhin ngo bo nyid gsungs te /

analyzed: gang gi tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi byin gyis brlabs pa las 'od gsal rnam par dag par byed do //

analyzed: d'a ri ka pa nam mkha' la //

analyzed: pha rol mchog gi 'gram du song //
translated: Go to the side of the supreme other.üîΩWhat is your mantra? What is your tantra?

original: mtshon dka' don dam mya ngan 'das //

original: bde sdug gcig tu byas nas ni //

original: don de nyid chos zab mo khong du chud pa'i grub pa'i slob dpon d'a ri kas gsungs so stong pa dang ni snying rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snying rje zhes pa ni kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems dang / stong pa zhes pa ni de yongs su rdzogs pa'i gzugs don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: don de nyid chos zab mo khong du chud pa'i grub pa'i slob dpon d'a ri kas gsungs so stong pa dang ni snying rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snying rje zhes pa ni kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems dang / stong pa zhes pa ni de yongs su rdzogs pa'i gzugs don dam pa'i bden pa'o //

analyzed: gnyis po dbyer med par nye bar spyod pas gzungs nas rdo rje bla ma'i drin las grub pa'i slob dpon d'a ri kas so //

analyzed: nam mkha' zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa stong nyid gsum du shes par bya'o //
translated: The space is to be known as the three emptinesses, such as appearance, etc.

original: de'i pha rol 'od gsal ba bde ba chen pos yongs su gang ba lus dang ngag dang yid rnams rang bzhin dang bral ba'i nges pas rnam par rol par byed do //
analyzed: de'i pha rol 'od gsal ba bde ba chen pos yongs su gang ba lus dang ngag dang yid rnams rang bzhin dang bral ba'i nges pas rnam par rol par byed do //
translated: Beyond that, he plays with the clear light, filled with great bliss, by the certainty of the body, speech, and mind being free from intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin du lung las kyang ;
analyzed: de bzhin du lung las kyang ;
translated: Likewise, it is also stated in the scriptures:

original: dngos po rnams las stong pa nyid //
analyzed: dngos po rnams las stong pa nyid //

original: gzhan dngos gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dngos gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: and the other is not real.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
