original: dhr'u'i rkang pas don de nyid brtan par byed do //
analyzed: dhr'u'i rkang pas don de nyid brtan par byed do //
translated: The half-verse of Dharu makes that very meaning firm.

original: mtshan nyid med ces pa ni ma skyes pa mtshan nyid med pa sems kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med ces pa ni ma skyes pa mtshan nyid med pa sems kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic-less is the unarisen, the characteristic-less, the characteristic of mind.

original: de yis 'od gsal ba'i sems kyis rnam par rol par byed de bde ba'i pha rol du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de yis 'od gsal ba'i sems kyis rnam par rol par byed de bde ba'i pha rol du 'gro ba'o //
translated: By that, the mind of clear light plays, going to the other side of bliss.

original: rkang pa gnyis pas gzhan ma yin par 'bod par byed do //üîΩkhyod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngags zhes pa ste phyi'i sngags bzlas pas kye'i byis pa rmongs pa'i rnal 'byor pa ci ste /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pas gzhan ma yin par 'bod par byed do // khyod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngags zhes pa ste phyi'i sngags bzlas pas kye'i byis pa rmongs pa'i rnal 'byor pa ci ste /
translated: The second half-verse calls it not other.üîΩYou, etc. is the mantra. O child, what is the use of the recitation of the external mantra?

original: khyod kyi rgyud kyi zhes te de la klog pa dang bsam gtan dang bshad pa 'dis kyang ci zhig byed /
analyzed: khyod kyi rgyud kyi zhes te de la klog pa dang bsam gtan dang bshad pa 'dis kyang ci zhig byed /
translated: What is the use of the recitation, contemplation, and explanation of your tantra?

original: rab tu mi gnas pa'i bde ba chen por thim pa'i phyir khyod kyis mya ngan las 'das pa mtshon dka' ba bla ma'i zhabs kyi rdul gyi 'od zer gyi drin las rab tu grub pa de nyid do //
analyzed: rab tu mi gnas pa'i bde ba chen por thim pa'i phyir khyod kyis mya ngan las 'das pa mtshon dka' ba bla ma'i zhabs kyi rdul gyi 'od zer gyi drin las rab tu grub pa de nyid do //
translated: Because it dissolves into the supreme bliss that is not at all static, that itself is your nirvana, which is difficult to illustrate, and which is well established through the grace of the light rays of the dust of the guru's feet.

original: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: In the same way, the venerable Saraha also says:

original: sngags dang rgyud ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sngags dang rgyud ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The so-called mantra and tantra... and so forth.

original: rkang pa gnyis pas lam gyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pas lam gyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs so //
translated: The second line praises the path.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sdug bsngal ni 'khor ba'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal zhes te /üîΩdon dam pa'i bden pas @193a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sdug bsngal ni 'khor ba'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal zhes te / don dam pa'i bden pas @193a * //
translated: Suffering and so forth: Suffering is the happiness and suffering of samsara.

original: lhan cig tu byas nas kye'i byis pa'i rnal 'byor pas bla ma'i drin la yul dang dbang po nye bar longs spyod par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig tu byas nas kye'i byis pa'i rnal 'byor pas bla ma'i drin la yul dang dbang po nye bar longs spyod par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Having combined it with ultimate truth, the yogi of the child should enjoy the objects and faculties through the grace of the guru.

original: 'di'i thabs kyis thams cad bla na med par gyur pa grub pa'i slob dpon d'a ri ka'i zhabs kyis so //
analyzed: 'di'i thabs kyis thams cad bla na med par gyur pa grub pa'i slob dpon d'a ri ka'i zhabs kyis so //
translated: By this method, everything becomes unsurpassed. This was composed by the siddha master, the venerable Darika.

original: 'khor ba la rang dang pha rol dang gzhan gyi cha shas dang dbye ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba la rang dang pha rol dang gzhan gyi cha shas dang dbye ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not see any part or division of samsara as self, other, or something else.

original: de bzhin du dho ka da'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dho ka da'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: Similarly, the venerable Dharmika says:

original: 'khor bar mang du yang dag 'khor gyur kyang //
analyzed: 'khor bar mang du yang dag 'khor gyur kyang //
translated: Although he has turned many times in samsara,

original: blo gros dang ldan 'di yi mthu yis ni //
analyzed: blo gros dang ldan 'di yi mthu yis ni //
translated: by the power of this intelligence,

original: dngos po dngos med zung du rnam par dpyad //
analyzed: dngos po dngos med zung du rnam par dpyad //
translated: he has analyzed the pair of entity and non-entity,

original: thams cad rang gi shes rab yang dag gnas //
analyzed: thams cad rang gi shes rab yang dag gnas //
translated: and everything abides in his own wisdom.

original: phyogs dang phyogs min lta zhing smra gyur pa //
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs min lta zhing smra gyur pa //
translated: Looking in all directions, he says:

original: bdag gis cung zad kyang ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: bdag gis cung zad kyang ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: I do not see even the slightest thing.

original: gzung ba dang ni 'dzin pa spangs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzung ba dang ni 'dzin pa spangs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of abandoning the grasped and the grasper,

original: dga' dang sdug bsngal ji bzhin de nyid do //
analyzed: dga' dang sdug bsngal ji bzhin de nyid do //
translated: he is just like joy and suffering.

original: rkang pa bzhi pas rang gi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi pas rang gi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te ;
translated: The fourth line praises his own [qualities].

original: rgyal po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa gsum gyis rang gi bya ba dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan mtshon no //
analyzed: rgyal po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa gsum gyis rang gi bya ba dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan mtshon no //
translated: The three lines beginning with king illustrate the qualities of his own actions, such as lordship.

original: gzhan du gang la lha dang klu'i dbang po la sogs pa yul la rmongs pas bcings nas gnas so //
analyzed: gzhan du gang la lha dang klu'i dbang po la sogs pa yul la rmongs pas bcings nas gnas so //
translated: Elsewhere, some, through ignorance of the object, are bound by the power of gods and nagas.

original: bdag ni slar yang l'u yi ba'i zhabs kyis drin las sa bcu gnyis pa'i rgyal pa dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni slar yang l'u yi ba'i zhabs kyis drin las sa bcu gnyis pa'i rgyal pa dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: I, however, through the kindness of the feet of Luipa, am equal to the king of the twelfth stage.

original: mal la ri zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs bha dra'i zhabs kyi'o //
analyzed: mal la ri zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs bha dra'i zhabs kyi'o //
translated: This is the song of the mountain called Bed, by the feet of Bhadra.

original: de tsam dus su 'dug kyang bdag ni shin tu rmongs //
analyzed: de tsam dus su 'dug kyang bdag ni shin tu rmongs //
translated: Even though I stayed there for that long, I was extremely ignorant.

original: da ni bla ma dam pa'i gsung las bdag gis rtogs //
analyzed: da ni bla ma dam pa'i gsung las bdag gis rtogs //
translated: Now, through the words of the holy guru, I have understood.

original: da ni bdag gi sems kyi rgyal po zhi bar gyur //
analyzed: da ni bdag gi sems kyi rgyal po zhi bar gyur //
translated: Now, the king of my mind has become peaceful.

original: nam mkha' rgya mtshor rab tu bskyod pas sleb par gyur //
analyzed: nam mkha' rgya mtshor rab tu bskyod pas sleb par gyur //
translated: By moving in the sky and ocean, I have arrived.

original: bdag gis bltas pas phyogs bcu thams cad stong pa nyid //
analyzed: bdag gis bltas pas phyogs bcu thams cad stong pa nyid //
translated: When I looked, all ten directions were emptiness.

original: sems dang rnam par bral bas sdig dang bsod nams med //
analyzed: sems dang rnam par bral bas sdig dang bsod nams med //
translated: Free from the mind, there is no sin or merit.

original: r'a hu la yis bdag la mtshan ma smras nas byan //
analyzed: r'a hu la yis bdag la mtshan ma smras nas byan //
translated: Rahula told me the signs and left.

original: nam mkha'i rgya mtshor bdag gi sems ni stor bar gyur //
analyzed: nam mkha'i rgya mtshor bdag gi sems ni stor bar gyur //
translated: In the sky and ocean, my mind was lost.

original: bha dras smras pa cha shas med pa rab tu long //
analyzed: bha dras smras pa cha shas med pa rab tu long //
translated: Bhadra said: The partless is well-known.

original: bdag gi sems kyi rgyal po nyid ni stor bar gyur //
analyzed: bdag gi sems kyi rgyal po nyid ni stor bar gyur //
translated: The king of my mind is lost.

original: ye shes kyi dga' bas rab tu tshim pa dang ldan pa'i grub pa'i slob dpon bha dra'i zhabs kyis don de nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi dga' bas rab tu tshim pa dang ldan pa'i grub pa'i slob dpon bha dra'i zhabs kyis don de nyid gsungs te /
translated: The venerable master Bhadra, who is satisfied with the joy of wisdom, has stated this very meaning.

original: @193b de tsam dus su zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba la dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa las so //
analyzed: @193b de tsam dus su zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba la dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa las so //
translated: Up to that time and so on means that in beginningless cyclic existence, one has been separated from the spiritual friend.

original: rmongs pa zhes pa phyi rol yul la chags pas dpag tu med pa'i bskal bar de srid du gnas par gyur nas /
analyzed: rmongs pa zhes pa phyi rol yul la chags pas dpag tu med pa'i bskal bar de srid du gnas par gyur nas /
translated: The deluded one, attached to external objects, has remained in that way for immeasurable eons.

original: da ni sangs rgyas kyis mthus bla ma dam pa dang phrad pas bdag gi sems kyi rang bzhin de kho na nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas kyis mthus bla ma dam pa dang phrad pas bdag gi sems kyi rang bzhin de kho na nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, by the power of the Buddha, having met with the excellent guru, my mind's nature will become reality.

original: dhr'u'i rkang pas don de nyid brtan par byed do //
analyzed: dhr'u'i rkang pas don de nyid brtan par byed do //
translated: The line dhar makes this meaning firm.

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni da ni rdo rje dang padma yang dag par sbyor bas mi 'gyur ba'i bde bas bdag gi sems kyi rgyal po med par gyur te /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni da ni rdo rje dang padma yang dag par sbyor bas mi 'gyur ba'i bde bas bdag gi sems kyi rgyal po med par gyur te /
translated: Now, by the union of the vajra and lotus, the king of my mind has become non-existent through unchanging bliss,

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal la rab tu zhugs so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal la rab tu zhugs so zhes pa'o //
translated: and has entered into natural luminosity.

original: rkang pa gnyis pas goms pa'i rang bzhin gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pas goms pa'i rang bzhin gsungs te /
translated: The second line speaks of the nature of cultivation.üîΩBy my looking, etc.

original: bdag gis bltas pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos thams cad dmigs pa med pa'i rnal 'byor gyis phyogs gang dang gang du bltas pa de dang de thams cad stong pa nyid 'od gsal gyi rang bzhin du bdag la so sor rab tu gsal ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis bltas pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos thams cad dmigs pa med pa'i rnal 'byor gyis phyogs gang dang gang du bltas pa de dang de thams cad stong pa nyid 'od gsal gyi rang bzhin du bdag la so sor rab tu gsal ba'o //
translated: By the yoga of the non-apprehension of all phenomena, whatever directions I look, all of them are clearly manifest to me as the nature of luminosity, emptiness.

original: de'i phyir bzhi pa shar bas sdig pa dang bsod nams la sogs pas kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir bzhi pa shar bas sdig pa dang bsod nams la sogs pas kyang /
translated: Therefore, by the dawning of the fourth, I know that even evil and merit, etc.

original: 'khor bar 'ching bar bdag gis shes bzhes so //
analyzed: 'khor bar 'ching bar bdag gis shes bzhes so //
translated: do not bind me in cyclic existence.

original: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: Similarly, the venerable Saraha also says:

original: sngon dang phyi ma zhes pas os //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma zhes pas os //
translated: The past and future are like a dream.

original: rkang pa gsum pas rdo rje bla ma'i mthu gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gsum pas rdo rje bla ma'i mthu gsungs te /
translated: The third line speaks of the power of the vajra master.

original: r'a hu la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje'i rigs la zhes te /
analyzed: r'a hu la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje'i rigs la zhes te /
translated: As for Rahula, etc., it is the vajra family.

original: rdo rje bla mas mtshon nas dngos po las grol nas bzhi pa'i dga' ba'i thabs rab tu spyin nas bdag gis slar yang gus pa dang bcas pas goms pas nam mkha' la zhes te /
analyzed: rdo rje bla mas mtshon nas dngos po las grol nas bzhi pa'i dga' ba'i thabs rab tu spyin nas bdag gis slar yang gus pa dang bcas pas goms pas nam mkha' la zhes te /
translated: Having been freed from things by means of the vajra master, having been given the means of the fourth joy, in the sky means that one should again practice with devotion.

original: 'od gsal gyi rgya mtshor ster bar byas pa zhes so //
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi rgya mtshor ster bar byas pa zhes so //
translated: It is said that one should give to the ocean of clear light.

original: rkang pa bzhi pas rang gi ngo bo nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi pas rang gi ngo bo nyid gsungs te /
translated: The fourth line speaks of its own nature.

original: smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni cha shas med pa zhes te /
analyzed: smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni cha shas med pa zhes te /
translated: As for said, etc., it is partless.

original: ma skyes pa'i cha bzang po'i zhabs bdag gis blangs pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i cha bzang po'i zhabs bdag gis blangs pa'o //
translated: The good-footed one, the partless one, is taken by me.

original: gang thog ma med pa'i srid pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gzhi sems kyi rgyal po bdag gis chos thams cad dmigs pa med pa'i rgya mtshor rab tu zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang thog ma med pa'i srid pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gzhi sems kyi rgyal po bdag gis chos thams cad dmigs pa med pa'i rgya mtshor rab tu zhugs pa'o //
translated: The king of minds, the basis of the concepts of beginningless existence, is taken by me into the ocean of the non-observation of all phenomena.

original: stong pa'i khyim ni yon por de nyid nges pa can /
analyzed: stong pa'i khyim ni yon por de nyid nges pa can /
translated: The empty house is crooked, but it is certain in reality.

original: gti mug mdzod ni blangs nas thams cad bskor bar gyur //üîΩgnyid yur sems med rang dang @194a * //
analyzed: gti mug mdzod ni blangs nas thams cad bskor bar gyur // gnyid yur sems med rang dang @194a * //
translated: Having taken up the treasure of delusion, all are turned around.

original: gzhan dag rnam par bral //
analyzed: gzhan dag rnam par bral //
translated: Having fallen asleep, without mind, separated from self and others,

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i gnyid du k'ahna pa ni song //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i gnyid du k'ahna pa ni song //
translated: having gone to sleep, the sleep of innate joy.

original: sems med tshor ba med bar shin du gnyid du song //
analyzed: sems med tshor ba med bar shin du gnyid du song //
translated: Having fallen asleep, without mind, without feeling,

original: thams cad grol bar byas nas bde bar gnyid du song //
analyzed: thams cad grol bar byas nas bde bar gnyid du song //
translated: having gone to sleep, having liberated all, happily.

original: bdag gi rmi lam na ni khams gsum stong par mthong //
analyzed: bdag gi rmi lam na ni khams gsum stong par mthong //
translated: In my dream, I saw the three realms as empty.

original: 'dres par byas nas 'gro dang 'ong ba bral bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dres par byas nas 'gro dang 'ong ba bral bar 'gyur //
translated: Having mixed, going and coming are gone.

original: dz'a landha ra'i zhabs las mngon sum nyid du byas //
analyzed: dz'a landha ra'i zhabs las mngon sum nyid du byas //
translated: From the feet of JƒÅlandhara, I made it manifest.

original: bdag gis rtsar yang pandi ta yis lta mi byed //
analyzed: bdag gis rtsar yang pandi ta yis lta mi byed //
translated: I, the pandit, do not look at the veins.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' bas brjod pa'i phyir nag po glu dbyangs zhabs kyis don de nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' bas brjod pa'i phyir nag po glu dbyangs zhabs kyis don de nyid gsungs so //
translated: K·πõ·π£·πáƒÅcƒÅryapƒÅda also taught that very meaning, in order to express innate joy.

original: stong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i stong pa zhes pa ni snang ba thob pa la dgongs pa'i shes pa de bzhin du bag chags la chags par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i stong pa zhes pa ni snang ba thob pa la dgongs pa'i shes pa de bzhin du bag chags la chags par rig par bya'o //
translated: The emptiness in emptiness and so forth refers to the consciousness that is intended to attain appearance, and it should be understood to be attached to traces.

original: rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gis de'i bag chags kyi skyon de bzhin nyid kyi ral gris rang bzhin gyi gti mug gi yul la chags pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad gcod pa zhes so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gis de'i bag chags kyi skyon de bzhin nyid kyi ral gris rang bzhin gyi gti mug gi yul la chags pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad gcod pa zhes so //
translated: The Lord of Yogins says that the fault of those traces is cut by the sword of suchness, which is the characteristic of being attached to the object of natural delusion.

original: dh'u'i rkang pas bsam gtan gyi mtshan nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: dh'u'i rkang pas bsam gtan gyi mtshan nyid gsungs te /
translated: Dh≈´tipƒÅda teaches the characteristics of concentration:

original: gnyid yur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rnal 'byor pas gnyid du song ste khyod la sems med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyid yur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rnal 'byor pas gnyid du song ste khyod la sems med pa'o //
translated: In sleep is the river, and so on, the yogi/nƒ´ of connate joy goes to sleep, and you are without mind.

original: de la nyams pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la nyams pa ni ma yin no //
translated: There is no fault in that.

original: de'i phyir nag po spyod pa pa brjid pa'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rnal 'byor pas gnyid du song ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nag po spyod pa pa brjid pa'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rnal 'byor pas gnyid du song ba'o //
translated: Therefore, because of the fear of the conduct of the dark one, the yogi/nƒ´ of connate joy goes to sleep.

original: de bzhin du brtag pa gnyis pa la skyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du brtag pa gnyis pa la skyang /
translated: Similarly, in the second chapter:

original: gnyid yur dug rnams za bar byed //
analyzed: gnyid yur dug rnams za bar byed //
translated: The poisons are eaten in sleep.

original: ches so // de'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba gnyid do //
analyzed: ches so // de'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba gnyid do //
translated: His innate joy is sleep.

original: rkang pa gnyis pas de nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pas de nyid gsungs te /
translated: The second line states just that.

original: sems med ces pa ni sems kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sems med ces pa ni sems kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: Without mind means without conceptualization of mind.

original: tshor ba yang de rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba yang de rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: Feeling means without conceptualization of that.

original: de'i phyir de'i ye shes kyi mtha' dag ces pa ni 'jig rten gsum po shin tu yongs su sbyangs pas ji lta ba bzhin du gyur pa de lta bu'i ye shes kyi gnyid du song ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i ye shes kyi mtha' dag ces pa ni 'jig rten gsum po shin tu yongs su sbyangs pas ji lta ba bzhin du gyur pa de lta bu'i ye shes kyi gnyid du song ba'o //
translated: Therefore, his omniscience means that he has gone to sleep in the omniscience that is just as it is, due to the thorough purification of the three worlds.

original: rkang pa gsum pas rang gi dgongs pa'i ye shes gsungs so //
analyzed: rkang pa gsum pas rang gi dgongs pa'i ye shes gsungs so //
translated: The third line states the wisdom of his intention.

original: rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba dang 'ong ba zhes pa ni sngon du gsungs pa'i rim pas zla ba dang nyi ma dag 'gro ba dang 'ong ba 'gog pa'i phyir 'dres mang byas pa zhes @194b pa ni aa wa dh'ut'ir rlung dang lhan cig
analyzed: rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba dang 'ong ba zhes pa ni sngon du gsungs pa'i rim pas zla ba dang nyi ma dag 'gro ba dang 'ong ba 'gog pa'i phyir 'dres mang byas pa zhes @194b pa ni aa wa dh'ut'ir rlung dang lhan cig
translated: In dream, etc., coming and going means that, due to the previously explained process, the moon and sun are blocked from coming and going. Mixed means that the winds of the avadh≈´tƒ´ and the life and downward winds are mixed.

original: skyes pa'i dga' ba la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir bdag gi rmi lam dang 'dra bar sa gsum pos tshong par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i dga' ba la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir bdag gi rmi lam dang 'dra bar sa gsum pos tshong par mthong ba'o //
translated: Because of being engaged in the joy of the birth, I see the three worlds as a dream.

original: de bzhin du lung las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du lung las kyang /
translated: Similarly, in the scriptures also:

original: ji ltar bu mo gzhon nu'i rmi lam mthar //
analyzed: ji ltar bu mo gzhon nu'i rmi lam mthar //
translated: Just as a young girl in a dream

original: de'i bu skye dang shi ba mthong gyur pa //
analyzed: de'i bu skye dang shi ba mthong gyur pa //
translated: sees the birth and death of a son,

original: skyes nas dga' dang shin nas mi dga' ba //
analyzed: skyes nas dga' dang shin nas mi dga' ba //
translated: and is joyful at the birth and sad at the death,

original: chos rnams thams cad de bzhin shes par gyis //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad de bzhin shes par gyis //
translated: so should you understand all phenomena.

original: rkang pa bzhi pas rdo rje bla ma'i bdag nyid che ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi pas rdo rje bla ma'i bdag nyid che ba gsungs te /
translated: The fourth line states the greatness of the guru Vajra.

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpal gyi bla ma dz'a landha ri'i zhabs kyis gang la chos nyid mngon sum du mdzad pa de'i zhabs kyi chu skyes kyi rdul la reg pa'i drin las so //
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpal gyi bla ma dz'a landha ri'i zhabs kyis gang la chos nyid mngon sum du mdzad pa de'i zhabs kyi chu skyes kyi rdul la reg pa'i drin las so //
translated: The words directly and so forth mean that by the kindness of touching the dust of the feet of the glorious guru Jalandharipa, who actualized reality,

original: gang dang gang rnams po sti bltas par gyur pa'i pandi ta'i slob dpon de dang de rnams kyis bdag gi rtsa bar yang nye bar ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang rnams po sti bltas par gyur pa'i pandi ta'i slob dpon de dang de rnams kyis bdag gi rtsa bar yang nye bar ma mthong ba'o //
translated: I, who was not seen even at the feet of the scholar-teachers who were looked up to,üîΩhave become a great scholar.

original: dga' ba ster ba zhes ba'i glu dbyangs t'a ta ka'i zhabs kyi'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ster ba zhes ba'i glu dbyangs t'a ta ka'i zhabs kyi'o //
translated: The song called Bestowing Joy is by TƒÅdaka.

original: rang nyid med pas bdag gi the tshom gang //
analyzed: rang nyid med pas bdag gi the tshom gang //
translated: Since I do not exist, my doubts are gone.

original: 'dam dang dong rtse'i 'dod pa bral bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dam dang dong rtse'i 'dod pa bral bar 'gyur //
translated: I am free from the desires of mud and a mirage.

original: nyams myong lhan skyes ma 'khrul rnal 'byor kye //
analyzed: nyams myong lhan skyes ma 'khrul rnal 'byor kye //
translated: O yogi of non-mistaken innate experience,

original: mtha' bzhi dang bral ji bzhin yin //
analyzed: mtha' bzhi dang bral ji bzhin yin //
translated: Free from the four extremes, it is just as it is.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa de ltar yod par gyis //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa de ltar yod par gyis //
translated: Whatever you wish, it exists in that way.

original: lhan skyes lam ni rnal 'byor 'khrul ma byed //
analyzed: lhan skyes lam ni rnal 'byor 'khrul ma byed //
translated: Do not be mistaken about the innate path, O yogi.

original: snod spyad sgrol pa po ni nyid kyis shes //
analyzed: snod spyad sgrol pa po ni nyid kyis shes //
translated: The one who liberates the vessel knows himself.

original: ngag gi lam las 'das pa ji ltar bshad //
analyzed: ngag gi lam las 'das pa ji ltar bshad //
translated: How can one explain what is beyond the path of speech?

original: t'a da ka yis 'di smra'i go skabs med //
analyzed: t'a da ka yis 'di smra'i go skabs med //
translated: TƒÅdaka has no opportunity to speak of this.

original: gang shes de yi mgul du zhags pas bcings //
analyzed: gang shes de yi mgul du zhags pas bcings //
translated: Whoever knows this is bound by a noose around his neck.

original: ya shes kyi btung bas rab tu tshim pa'i grub pa'i slob dpon t'a da ka nyid kyis don de nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: ya shes kyi btung bas rab tu tshim pa'i grub pa'i slob dpon t'a da ka nyid kyis don de nyid gsungs so //
translated: The very same meaning is stated by the accomplished master TƒÅdaka himself, who was completely satisfied by the drink of wisdom.

original: rang nyid med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bla ma'i zhabs kyi rdul gyi drin las de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi thabs kyi sgo nas rang gi lus rnam par dpyad pas bdag dang bdag gi 'grel pa cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bla ma'i zhabs kyi rdul gyi drin las de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi thabs kyi sgo nas rang gi lus rnam par dpyad pas bdag dang bdag gi 'grel pa cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As for since there is no self, etc., it is by the grace of the guru's dust that one, by means of the Tathagata's speech, analyzes one's body, and finds that there is not even the slightest trace of an I or mine.

original: de'i phyir glo bur gyi phung po dang nyon mongs pa dang 'chi bdag gi bdud la sogs pa rnams kyi som nyi za ba yang bdag la med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir glo bur gyi phung po dang nyon mongs pa dang 'chi bdag gi bdud la sogs pa rnams kyi som nyi za ba yang bdag la med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one has no doubt about the demons of the adventitious aggregates, afflictions, and Lord of Death, etc.

original: da bzhin du lung las kyang //
analyzed: da bzhin du lung las kyang //
translated: Likewise, it is stated in scripture:

original: bdag ni 'jug par byed ces bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: bdag ni 'jug par byed ces bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: I am the one who engages, etc.

original: de la nga ni bdag gi srid pa'i don gyi rnam par rtog @195a * //
analyzed: de la nga ni bdag gi srid pa'i don gyi rnam par rtog @195a * //
translated: There, I is the nature of the conceptualization of the meaning of self-existence.

original: ba'i ngo bo la phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'dod pa rnams ni shin tu ring du byas pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i ngo bo la phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'dod pa rnams ni shin tu ring du byas pa'o //
translated: Those who desire the spiritual power of the great seal have gone very far astray.

original: de bzhin du lung las kyang //üîΩ'ga' zhig sngon du bcings med cing //
analyzed: de bzhin du lung las kyang // 'ga' zhig sngon du bcings med cing //
translated: Likewise, it is stated in scripture:üîΩNo one was bound before,

original: da ni grol bar gyur pa med //
analyzed: da ni grol bar gyur pa med //
translated: and now is liberated.

original: 'dir ni bcings grol rnam rtog pa //
analyzed: 'dir ni bcings grol rnam rtog pa //
translated: Here, bondage and liberation are conceptual,

original: gang de ye shes mtshan nyid min //
analyzed: gang de ye shes mtshan nyid min //
translated: but that is not the characteristic of wisdom.

original: dhr'u'i rkang pas gsungs pa'i don de nyid gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: dhr'u'i rkang pas gsungs pa'i don de nyid gsal bar byed do //
translated: The meaning stated by the lines beginning with ‚Äúdhruv‚Äù is clarified.

original: nyams myong zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag la yang dag par 'bod par byed do //
analyzed: nyams myong zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag la yang dag par 'bod par byed do //
translated: ‚Äú Experience‚Äù and so on addresses the self.üîΩ‚Äú Kye!

original: kye'i t'a da ka nyams su myong ba'i don ji ltar brjod par nus te /
analyzed: kye'i t'a da ka nyams su myong ba'i don ji ltar brjod par nus te /
translated: TƒÅdaka! How can the meaning of experience be expressed?

original: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba ni lhan cig skyes pa zhes ji ltar rjod par byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba ni lhan cig skyes pa zhes ji ltar rjod par byed /
translated: Therefore, how can experience be called ‚Äòinnate‚Äô?

original: nye bar sgom pa kun rdzob tu mi 'gog pas gzhan la mos par byed /
analyzed: nye bar sgom pa kun rdzob tu mi 'gog pas gzhan la mos par byed /
translated: Since the cultivation of the relative is not refuted, one should believe in something other than that.

original: rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: The nature is not.

original: de bzhin du lung las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du lung las kyang /
translated: Likewise, it says in the Tantra of the Great River of the Inconceivable Secrets of Alikali:üîΩThe Buddha is not found through

original: tshig tu sbyor ba ston pa yis //
analyzed: tshig tu sbyor ba ston pa yis //
translated: the teaching of verbal application.üîΩThe Buddha is not found through

original: sangs rgyas gnyis su med par brtag / bsam med mchog la sbyor ba yis//
analyzed: sangs rgyas gnyis su med par brtag / bsam med mchog la sbyor ba yis//
translated: the application to the supreme, the inconceivable.

original: sangs rgyas kyang med gnyis med med //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang med gnyis med med //
translated: The Buddha is not found throughüîΩthe application to the inconceivable.

original: de'i phyir mtha' bzhi las grol ba'i ngo bo las slar yang de'i rab tu byed pas gnas ba zhes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtha' bzhi las grol ba'i ngo bo las slar yang de'i rab tu byed pas gnas ba zhes so //
translated: Therefore, from the nature that is free from the four extremes, again, by its activity, it abides.

original: de bzhin du lung las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du lung las kyang /
translated: Similarly, in the scriptures,üîΩit is said,

original: yod min med min yod med min //
analyzed: yod min med min yod med min //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not existent, not nonexistent, not existent and nonexistent.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so /
translated: And so on.

original: rkang pa gnyis pas don de nyid so sor rgyas par ston par byed do //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pas don de nyid so sor rgyas par ston par byed do //
translated: The second line teaches just that meaning individually in detail.

original: ji bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang skye ba'i dus su grub pa'i bdag med pa la mngon par chags pa las bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du rgyas pa'i nga rgyal ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'o //
analyzed: ji bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang skye ba'i dus su grub pa'i bdag med pa la mngon par chags pa las bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du rgyas pa'i nga rgyal ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as‚Äù and so on. That which is the nature of great bliss, expanded from attachment to the selflessness that is established at the time of arising, is the nature of the great vajra holder.

original: slar yang rdo rje bal mas de la nges pa'i don bstan par byed do //
analyzed: slar yang rdo rje bal mas de la nges pa'i don bstan par byed do //
translated: Again, the vajra lady teaches the definitive meaning to him.

original: de'i phyir kye'i grub pa'i slob dpon lhan cig skyes pa dang tha dad ma byed cig pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir kye'i grub pa'i slob dpon lhan cig skyes pa dang tha dad ma byed cig pa ste /
translated: Therefore, ‚ÄúO master of spiritual practice, do not make the connate and the differentiated.‚Äù

original: the tshom med pas seng ge'i tshul gyis 'gro ba la bgrod par byed do //
analyzed: the tshom med pas seng ge'i tshul gyis 'gro ba la bgrod par byed do //
translated: Without doubt, one should proceed by the method of the lion.

original: rkang pa gsum pas rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi mtshan ma gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gsum pas rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi mtshan ma gsungs te /
translated: The third line states the characteristics of the lord of yogins.

original: snod spyad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni dper na pha rol tshu rol du sgrol bar byed pas sgrol ba'i gla len pa'i phyir pha rol gyi 'gro gnas su rnam par thar par 'dod pa rnams 'gro ba la lta bar byed do //
analyzed: snod spyad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni dper na pha rol tshu rol du sgrol bar byed pas sgrol ba'i gla len pa'i phyir pha rol gyi 'gro gnas su rnam par thar par 'dod pa rnams 'gro ba la lta bar byed do //
translated: As for utensils and so on, just as one who wishes to cross to the other side looks at the road to the other side in order to pay the ferry fee, so too, those who wish to cross to liberation look at the road to liberation.

original: de rnams kyi snod spyad la sogs pa 'gog pa'i bye brag kyang lta bar @195b byed do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi snod spyad la sogs pa 'gog pa'i bye brag kyang lta bar @195b byed do //
translated: They also look at the particular obstructions to the utensils and so on.

original: phyi'i don las 'das pa rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i chos 'jig rten gyi tshig gi sgo nas ji ltar bstan par bya /
analyzed: phyi'i don las 'das pa rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i chos 'jig rten gyi tshig gi sgo nas ji ltar bstan par bya /
translated: How can the Dharma, which is beyond external objects and possesses the characteristic of self-awareness, be taught through worldly words?

original: de bzhin du yang dag la yid ches pa'i chos rtogs pa byas pa las yon tan nyis 'gyur gyi rtags 'jig rten pas nges pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag la yid ches pa'i chos rtogs pa byas pa las yon tan nyis 'gyur gyi rtags 'jig rten pas nges pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi'o //
translated: In the same way, the lord of yogins' sign of twofold qualities is ascertained by the world through the realization of the Dharma that is truly trustworthy.

original: de bzhin du lung las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du lung las kyang /
translated: Similarly, it is said in the scriptures:

original: du ba las ni mer shes bzhin //
analyzed: du ba las ni mer shes bzhin //
translated: Just as fire is known from smoke,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: and so on.

original: rkang pa bzhi pas shin du rnam par mi rtog pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi pas shin du rnam par mi rtog pa gsungs so //
translated: The fourth line speaks of the utterly nonconceptual.

original: smra ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i slob dpon t'a da kas de bzhin du smra bar byed do //
analyzed: smra ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i slob dpon t'a da kas de bzhin du smra bar byed do //
translated: The master of reasoning TƒÄRƒÄNƒÄTHA also speaks in the same way:

original: 'di'i chos la byis pa'i rnal 'byor pas go skabs tsam yang med do zhes so //
analyzed: 'di'i chos la byis pa'i rnal 'byor pas go skabs tsam yang med do zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe Dharma of these [buddhas] is not even accessible to the yogis of the childish stage.‚Äù

original: gang zhig yang don dam par rig pa de rnams kyang gal te smra bar byed na'ang 'dis chos khong du chud par byas nas de'i tshe de nyid kyi mgul par 'khor ba'i zhags pas bcings pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig yang don dam par rig pa de rnams kyang gal te smra bar byed na'ang 'dis chos khong du chud par byas nas de'i tshe de nyid kyi mgul par 'khor ba'i zhags pas bcings pa'o //
translated: And if those who understand the ultimate do speak, then they do so after having understood the Dharma, and at that time they are bound by the noose around the neck of that [Dharma].

original: de bzhin du lung las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du lung las kyang /
translated: And so it is said in the scriptures:üîΩ‚ÄúEven the leaves of a poison tree

original: til dang sbun pa tsam gyi dug gi lo mas kyang //
analyzed: til dang sbun pa tsam gyi dug gi lo mas kyang //
translated: are poisonous.‚Äù

original: zhes pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas so //
translated: and so on.

original: bhee ra bi zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs sa ra ha'i zhabs kyi'o //
analyzed: bhee ra bi zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs sa ra ha'i zhabs kyi'o //
translated: The song called BHAIRAVI is by the venerable Saraha.

original: lus ni gru yi dum bu yid ni skya ba ste //
analyzed: lus ni gru yi dum bu yid ni skya ba ste //
translated: The body is a piece of the ship, the mind is the rudder,

original: bla ma dam pa'i gsung gi skya ba 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma dam pa'i gsung gi skya ba 'dzin pa'o //
translated: and the words of the holy guru are the rudder-man.

original: sems nyid brtan pa nyid du bzung gis gru pa rnams //
analyzed: sems nyid brtan pa nyid du bzung gis gru pa rnams //
translated: The mind itself is to be held steady, sailors!

original: thabs gzhan gyis ni pha rol 'gro ba med //
analyzed: thabs gzhan gyis ni pha rol 'gro ba med //
translated: There is no going to the other shore by any other means.

original: gru ni 'bab pa gru shing mnyen pa'i yon tan yin //
analyzed: gru ni 'bab pa gru shing mnyen pa'i yon tan yin //
translated: The boat is the quality of the flexible oar.

original: tshogs zhing tshogs pas lhan cig skyes pas gzhan du shes //
analyzed: tshogs zhing tshogs pas lhan cig skyes pas gzhan du shes //
translated: The assembly of the field of merit is known as the coemergent by the assembly.

original: lam ni 'gog pa'i 'jigs pa rnam par 'ong bar gyur //
analyzed: lam ni 'gog pa'i 'jigs pa rnam par 'ong bar gyur //
translated: The path is the fear of cessation, which is to be overcome.

original: srid pa'i dba' rlabs thams cad rnam par 'khrugs par gyur //
analyzed: srid pa'i dba' rlabs thams cad rnam par 'khrugs par gyur //
translated: All the waves of existence are to be agitated.

original: pha rol tshu rol chu rgyun drag por rab tu 'bab //
analyzed: pha rol tshu rol chu rgyun drag por rab tu 'bab //
translated: The current of the river flows strongly to the other shore.

original: sa ra ha yi zhabs kyis smras pa nam mkha'i ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: sa ra ha yi zhabs kyis smras pa nam mkha'i ting nge 'dzin //
translated: The venerable Saraha says: Space-like samadhi.

original: byams pa'i rang bzhin can sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang don de nyid lus la glu dgongs pa'i skad kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: byams pa'i rang bzhin can sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang don de nyid lus la glu dgongs pa'i skad kyis gsungs so //
translated: The venerable Saraha, who is of the nature of love, also taught this very meaning in the language of song.

original: lus ni gru'i dum bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rten dang brten pa'i 'brel bas lus la grur yongs su brtags so //
analyzed: lus ni gru'i dum bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rten dang brten pa'i 'brel bas lus la grur yongs su brtags so //
translated: The body is the piece of the boat, and so on. By the connection of the support and the supported, the body is fully imagined as the boat.

original: yid ni rnam par shes pa gra'i kyis ba nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: yid ni rnam par shes pa gra'i kyis ba nyid kyang ngo //
translated: The mind is the consciousness, the boat.

original: bla ma dam pa'i @196a * //
analyzed: bla ma dam pa'i @196a * //
translated: Having been seized by the gentle words of the holy guru,üîΩwith the union of the vajra and the lotus, in the middle of the ocean of existence,üîΩmake firm the conventional spirit of enlightenment, purified by the nature of the five intuitions, free from characteristics,

original: gsung gi mnyen pas bzung nas rdo rje dang chu skyes mnyam par sbyor bas srid pa'i chu gter gyi dbus su ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid mtshan nyid dang bral bas rnam par sbyangs pa'i kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems brtan par byed pas lus kyi gru mi 'gyurüîΩbar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: gsung gi mnyen pas bzung nas rdo rje dang chu skyes mnyam par sbyor bas srid pa'i chu gter gyi dbus su ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid mtshan nyid dang bral bas rnam par sbyangs pa'i kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems brtan par byed pas lus kyi gru mi 'gyur bar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: with the boat of the body, not wavering.

original: kye'i sa ra ha'i zhabs srid pa'i rgya mtsho las sgrol ba'i thabs gzhan med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kye'i sa ra ha'i zhabs srid pa'i rgya mtsho las sgrol ba'i thabs gzhan med do zhes pa'o //
translated: O, the feet of Saraha, there is no other means of crossing the ocean of existence.

original: de bzhin du au da'i zhabs kyes kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du au da'i zhabs kyes kyang /
translated: In the same way, the venerable Udbhatasiddhasvamin also says:

original: lnga po 'di yis gti mug 'gram las sgrol bar byed //üîΩpha rol du ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: lnga po 'di yis gti mug 'gram las sgrol bar byed // pha rol du ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: These five cross over the shore of delusion.üîΩThe other side is with the two lines beginning ‚Äúhaving gone to the other side.‚Äù

original: rkang pa gnyis pas lam gyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pas lam gyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
translated: In the second line he praises the path.

original: gru ni 'bab dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper na phyi rol du gru 'gro ba skya pa 'dzin pa'i yon tan gyis 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: gru ni 'bab dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper na phyi rol du gru 'gro ba skya pa 'dzin pa'i yon tan gyis 'dren par byed do //
translated: For example, externally, the boat is drawn by the quality of the wind that holds it back.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gru ni yang nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gru ni yang nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: In the same way, here, the boat is the experience.

original: kye'i rnal 'byor pa rdo rje bla ma'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i thabs zung la gru ni yongs su ma spong cig pa'o //
analyzed: kye'i rnal 'byor pa rdo rje bla ma'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i thabs zung la gru ni yongs su ma spong cig pa'o //
translated: O yogi, take up the method of the innate joy of the vajra guru, and do not abandon the boat!

original: gang gi de ma thag tu bde ba chen po'i gling du song cig pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi de ma thag tu bde ba chen po'i gling du song cig pa'o //
translated: Go to the island of great bliss immediately!

original: rkang pa gsum pas bdud kyi las su gnas pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa gsum pas bdud kyi las su gnas pa gsungs te /
translated: The third line states the activity of Mara.üîΩOn the path, etc.

original: lam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zas dang skom dang yul la sgrub pa po chags pa nyid kyi tshe lam nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zas dang skom dang yul la sgrub pa po chags pa nyid kyi tshe lam nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the practitioner is attached to food, drink, and objects, the path is lost.

original: aa wa dh'u t'ir song bas spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: aa wa dh'u t'ir song bas spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the entry into the avadhuti, it is abandoned.üîΩThe cessation, etc.

original: 'gog pa'i zhes pa ni de'i tshe zla ba dang nyi ma gnyis stobs dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i zhes pa ni de'i tshe zla ba dang nyi ma gnyis stobs dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: At that time, the moon and sun become powerful.

original: rgyu de'i phyir srid pa'i rgya mtshor yul gyi dba' rlabs kyi bdag med pa'i chos la thams cad kyis rab tu byed pas 'khrul bar gyur pa zhes so //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir srid pa'i rgya mtshor yul gyi dba' rlabs kyi bdag med pa'i chos la thams cad kyis rab tu byed pas 'khrul bar gyur pa zhes so //
translated: For that reason, in the ocean of existence, by the waves of objects, all are deluded by the Dharma of selflessness.

original: rkang pa bzhi pas aa wa dh'u t'i'i lam gyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi pas aa wa dh'u t'i'i lam gyi rjes su bsngags pa gsungs te /
translated: The fourth line states the praise of the path of the avadh≈´tƒ´.

original: pha rol tshu rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kun la zhes pa lam ngan pa zla ba la sogs pa ste gang du aa wa dh'u t'i la thim par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tshu rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kun la zhes pa lam ngan pa zla ba la sogs pa ste gang du aa wa dh'u t'i la thim par gyur pa'o //
translated: The words this shore and the other shore and so on refer to the bad path of the moon and so on, where the avadh≈´tƒ´ dissolves.

original: de ni rang bzhin gyi yongs su dag pa aa wa dh'u t'i'i sgras rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyi yongs su dag pa aa wa dh'u t'i'i sgras rtogs par bya'o //
translated: That is to be understood by the word avadh≈´tƒ´, which is naturally pure.

original: la ya zhes pa ni de gzung nas so //
analyzed: la ya zhes pa ni de gzung nas so //
translated: The word alaya means having grasped that.

original: rgyun drag po zhes pa ni bde ba chen po'i 'dod chags kyi rgyun gyis 'jug pas don dam pa rig pa gang byang chub kyi sems kyi rdo rje ste de steng du 'gro @196b bar byed do //
analyzed: rgyun drag po zhes pa ni bde ba chen po'i 'dod chags kyi rgyun gyis 'jug pas don dam pa rig pa gang byang chub kyi sems kyi rdo rje ste de steng du 'gro @196b bar byed do //
translated: The forceful current is the current of passion for great bliss. The ultimate knowledge, which is the vajra of bodhicitta, moves upward by that.

original: nam mkha' zhes pa ni dri ma med pa'i 'khor lo'i gling du thim par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes pa ni dri ma med pa'i 'khor lo'i gling du thim par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: The so-called space dissolves into the island of the stainless wheel.

original: m'a la l'a si zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs sa ra ha'i zhabs kyi'o //
analyzed: m'a la l'a si zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs sa ra ha'i zhabs kyi'o //
translated: The song called MƒÅlƒÅlas is by the venerable Saraha.

original: stong nyid lag pas hrol cig kye //
analyzed: stong nyid lag pas hrol cig kye //
translated: Open up with the hand of emptiness, O mind!

original: khyod kyi rang gi yid kyi skyon //
analyzed: khyod kyi rang gi yid kyi skyon //
translated: Your own mental faults

original: bla ma'i gsung gi spyod lam kye //
analyzed: bla ma'i gsung gi spyod lam kye //
translated: are the conduct of the guru‚Äôs speech, O mind!

original: khyod nyid slar sdong ji lta bu //
analyzed: khyod nyid slar sdong ji lta bu //
translated: How will you stand up again?

original: rmad byung h'um skyes nam mkha' la //üîΩkyog por 'gro ba bslang gis la //
analyzed: rmad byung h'um skyes nam mkha' la // kyog por 'gro ba bslang gis la //
translated: The wondrous hum arises in the sky,üîΩbut you, O mind, are crooked.

original: pha rol 'gro ba 'joms pa yis //
analyzed: pha rol 'gro ba 'joms pa yis //
translated: You are destroyed by going to the other side.

original: khyod kyi g-yo sgyu sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: khyod kyi g-yo sgyu sna tshogs pa //
translated: Your various deceptions

original: ngo mtshar srid pa'i gti mug la //
analyzed: ngo mtshar srid pa'i gti mug la //
translated: are the wonder of the ignorance of existence.

original: kye ma rang dang gzhan dag mthong //
analyzed: kye ma rang dang gzhan dag mthong //
translated: Alas! You see yourself and others.

original: 'gro 'di chu yi chu bur 'dra //
analyzed: 'gro 'di chu yi chu bur 'dra //
translated: This world is like a water bubble.üîΩI have the connate emptiness,

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i stong pa bdag / bdud rtsi yod bzhin dug med kyi //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i stong pa bdag / bdud rtsi yod bzhin dug med kyi //
translated: but not the poison, O mind!

original: gzhan dbang sems kyi bdag khyim na //
analyzed: gzhan dbang sems kyi bdag khyim na //
translated: In the house of the mind, which is dependent,

original: btung ba bdag gis go'o kye //
analyzed: btung ba bdag gis go'o kye //
translated: I drink the water, O mind!

original: bdag ni ma rungs gnyen 'dun za //
analyzed: bdag ni ma rungs gnyen 'dun za //
translated: I am a monster who devours my friends.

original: sa ra ha sa smras mchog yin gyur //
analyzed: sa ra ha sa smras mchog yin gyur //
translated: Saraha is the best of speakers.

original: bdag ci ma rungs glang la ni //
analyzed: bdag ci ma rungs glang la ni //
translated: I am a monster who devours my friends.

original: gcig pus 'gro ba 'joms par byed //
analyzed: gcig pus 'gro ba 'joms par byed //
translated: I alone destroy the world.

original: kye ma bdag ni rang 'dod spyod //
analyzed: kye ma bdag ni rang 'dod spyod //
translated: Alas, I am self-indulgent.

original: grub pa'i slob dpon sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis don de nyid dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rtogs nas 'jig rten pa'i ched du gsungs so //
analyzed: grub pa'i slob dpon sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis don de nyid dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rtogs nas 'jig rten pa'i ched du gsungs so //
translated: The accomplished master Saraha, having realized the nature of reality, spoke this for the sake of the world.

original: stong nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni kye'i rang gi yid sems kyi rgyal po khyod ma rig ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams bde ba ma yin pa'i ngo bor rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni kye'i rang gi yid sems kyi rgyal po khyod ma rig ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams bde ba ma yin pa'i ngo bor rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: The words emptiness and so forth are addressed to the king of the mind, the self-mind.

original: rmi lam gyi rjes la yang mngon par 'dod pa de yis dper na lha thams cad lag tu rnam par brkyang ba bzhin dang gnyid sad pa bzhin du de rnams kyi slar yang gang ji ltar smra zhes so//
analyzed: rmi lam gyi rjes la yang mngon par 'dod pa de yis dper na lha thams cad lag tu rnam par brkyang ba bzhin dang gnyid sad pa bzhin du de rnams kyi slar yang gang ji ltar smra zhes so//
translated: After the dream, the one who desires that, like a god stretching out his hand, or like one who is awake, again says, What did they say?

original: de la da ni sangs rgyas kyi bsod nams kyi mthus bdag gi bla ma dam pa'i gsung gi zla ba'i 'od zer gyi rang bzhin gyis 'jig rten gsum po rab tu gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de la da ni sangs rgyas kyi bsod nams kyi mthus bdag gi bla ma dam pa'i gsung gi zla ba'i 'od zer gyi rang bzhin gyis 'jig rten gsum po rab tu gsal ba'o //
translated: Now, by the power of the Buddha's merit, the three worlds are well illuminated by the nature of the light rays of the moon of the speech of my holy guru.

original: de'i phyir gnas gang du khyod gnas byed de kye'i sems kyi rgyal po zhes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas gang du khyod gnas byed de kye'i sems kyi rgyal po zhes so //
translated: Therefore, wherever you dwell, O king of the mind,

original: dh'u'i rkang pas don de nyid brtan par byed do //
analyzed: dh'u'i rkang pas don de nyid brtan par byed do //
translated: the Dh√ªtakas make that place firm.

original: rmad du byung ba ni ngo mtshar ba bla ma'i zhabs kyi padma'i drin las rol pa'i phyir bdag gis rtogs pa h'um yig sa bon las byung ba /
analyzed: rmad du byung ba ni ngo mtshar ba bla ma'i zhabs kyi padma'i drin las rol pa'i phyir bdag gis rtogs pa h'um yig sa bon las byung ba /
translated: The marvelous is the wonder, arisen from the seed syllable h≈´·πÉ, which I realize, by the grace of the guru's lotus feet.

original: kye'i sems kyi rgyal po nam mkha' la zhes te 'od gsal la rab tu zhugs pa'o //üîΩda ni ma rig pa'i skyon @197a * //
analyzed: kye'i sems kyi rgyal po nam mkha' la zhes te 'od gsal la rab tu zhugs pa'o // da ni ma rig pa'i skyon @197a * //
translated: O king of the mind, in the sky, that is, fully entered into clear light.

original: sna tshogs pa 'gyod pa bcom pa khyod nyid de //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa 'gyod pa bcom pa khyod nyid de //
translated: Now, you yourself have destroyed the various faults of ignorance,üîΩthe remorse.

original: rkang pa gnyis pas sems can shin tu chen po'i rjes su bsngags pa gsungs ta /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pas sems can shin tu chen po'i rjes su bsngags pa gsungs ta /
translated: The second line praises you, O great being,

original: ngo mtshar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni srid pa'i sems can gyi ci ste gti mug la gang ngo mtshar ba gang las bdag gis ngo bo mi shes pa'i phyir rang dang gzhan dang pha rol tu 'byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba lta bar byed do //
analyzed: ngo mtshar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni srid pa'i sems can gyi ci ste gti mug la gang ngo mtshar ba gang las bdag gis ngo bo mi shes pa'i phyir rang dang gzhan dang pha rol tu 'byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba lta bar byed do //
translated: The verse beginning with ‚ÄúHow wondrous!‚Äù refers to the fact that sentient beings in cyclic existence, due to their ignorance, make distinctions of self, other, and the far side, as if they were seeing something wondrous.

original: de'i phyir de'i nga rgyal byed pas yid la don dam pa sems la 'char ba khyod len par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i nga rgyal byed pas yid la don dam pa sems la 'char ba khyod len par byed do //
translated: Therefore, you who are proud of that, you who take it to be the ultimate meaning that arises in the mind,

original: de bzhin du lung las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du lung las kyang /
translated: in the same way, it is said in the scriptures:

original: nga rgyal dang bcas yid mi bzang //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang bcas yid mi bzang //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind with pride is not good,

original: skye bar 'jug cing 'ching bar byed //üîΩnga rgyal dang bral 'gro ba yang //
analyzed: skye bar 'jug cing 'ching bar byed // nga rgyal dang bral 'gro ba yang //
translated: it enters birth and creates bondage.üîΩThe mind without pride,

original: sems la bdag lta de nas bral //
analyzed: sems la bdag lta de nas bral //
translated: is free from the view of self.

original: ston pa gzhan med 'gro ba la //
analyzed: ston pa gzhan med 'gro ba la //
translated: There is no other teacher,

original: rgyal ba med cing bdag med smra //
analyzed: rgyal ba med cing bdag med smra //
translated: the Victorious One speaks of no self in the world.

original: gzhan min de las nye bar zhi //
analyzed: gzhan min de las nye bar zhi //
translated: There is no other, it is peace from that.

original: bsgrub pa de la 'di yid lam //
analyzed: bsgrub pa de la 'di yid lam //
translated: The mind is established in that.

original: de nyid rigs la chu zla sogs//
analyzed: de nyid rigs la chu zla sogs//
translated: In that very lineage, the moon in water, etc.,

original: dpe ni bcu gnyis sgo ru gyis //
analyzed: dpe ni bcu gnyis sgo ru gyis //
translated: are the twelve examples.

original: thams cad stong pa'i tshad ma yis //
analyzed: thams cad stong pa'i tshad ma yis //
translated: By the valid cognition of the emptiness of everything,

original: skye ba med la sgrub por byed //
analyzed: skye ba med la sgrub por byed //
translated: one establishes the unborn.

original: ces so // rkang pa gsum pas dga' ba bzhi'i bdag nyid che ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces so // rkang pa gsum pas dga' ba bzhi'i bdag nyid che ba gsungs te /
translated: The third line states the greatness of the nature of the four joys.

original: bdud rtsi zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba la ngas pa yong na gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi dug ji ltar spyod par byed /
analyzed: bdud rtsi zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba la ngas pa yong na gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi dug ji ltar spyod par byed /
translated: If one is satisfied with the innate joy called ‚Äúnectar,‚Äù how can one enjoy the poisons of objects such as form?

original: kye'i las kyi dbang phyug sems kyi rnam par dpyod pa can //
analyzed: kye'i las kyi dbang phyug sems kyi rnam par dpyod pa can //
translated: O lord of action, you who analyze the mind,

original: khyim zhes pa ni rang gi lus kyi btung ba can zhes te /
analyzed: khyim zhes pa ni rang gi lus kyi btung ba can zhes te /
translated: ‚Äúhome‚Äù is one‚Äôs own body, and ‚Äúdrink‚Äù is

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug la sogs pa'i tshogs la khyod kyi rang gi khyim mi mo ye shes kyi phyag rgya bdag med ma la yang dag par 'khyud pa de'i btung ba ni rang bzhin med par bdag gis byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug la sogs pa'i tshogs la khyod kyi rang gi khyim mi mo ye shes kyi phyag rgya bdag med ma la yang dag par 'khyud pa de'i btung ba ni rang bzhin med par bdag gis byed pa'o //
translated: the assembly of desire, hatred, ignorance, and so on. You embrace your wife, the wisdom mudra Nairatmya, and I will make her drink the elixir of selflessness.

original: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: Similarly, the venerable Saraha says:

original: khyim mi mo la gzhan gyi dug ni za bar byed //
analyzed: khyim mi mo la gzhan gyi dug ni za bar byed //
translated: The wife drinks the poison of others.

original: ces pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pas so //
translated: and so on.

original: rkang pa bzhi pas rang gi 'dod pa'i spyod pa gsungs te /üîΩgrub pa'i slob dpon sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi pas rang gi 'dod pa'i spyod pa gsungs te / grub pa'i slob dpon sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: The fourth line states his own practice.üîΩThe Acarya Saraha also says:

original: sa ra has smras zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma rungs glang la zhes pa ni ma rungs pa yul gyi stobs ster ba'i phyir dushta ba la da sems kyi rgyal por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sa ra has smras zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma rungs glang la zhes pa ni ma rungs pa yul gyi stobs ster ba'i phyir dushta ba la da sems kyi rgyal por rig par bya'o //
translated: The king of the mind, the elephant, is known as wicked when it gives the power of the objects.

original: gcig pu de yis ma rungs 'jig @197b rten gsum 'joms pas //
analyzed: gcig pu de yis ma rungs 'jig @197b rten gsum 'joms pas //
translated: The world is destroyed by that one wicked elephant.

original: de lta bas na ma rungs pa'i glang pos bdag gis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma rungs pa'i glang pos bdag gis ci zhig bya //
translated: Therefore, what should I do with the wicked elephant?

original: go zhes pa ni glang po'o //
analyzed: go zhes pa ni glang po'o //
translated: The elephant is called go.

original: de'i dmigs pa dang bcas pa lus la stong pa 'od gsal gyi gzugs su byas nas bla ma'i gsung gi drin las rang gi 'dun pas 'gro ba gsum du rnam par spyod par byed do //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa dang bcas pa lus la stong pa 'od gsal gyi gzugs su byas nas bla ma'i gsung gi drin las rang gi 'dun pas 'gro ba gsum du rnam par spyod par byed do //
translated: Having made the body empty, the form of clear light, together with its object, by the grace of the guru's instruction, one wanders in the three worlds by one's own will.

original: de bzhin du zhi ba lha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhi ba lha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: Similarly, the venerable Santideva also says:

original: rang gi 'dun pas spyod pa'i gnas //
analyzed: rang gi 'dun pas spyod pa'i gnas //
translated: The place of wandering by one's own will,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: and so on.

original: m'a la sa'i go da la zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs nag po spyod pa'i zhabs kyi'o //
analyzed: m'a la sa'i go da la zhes bya ba'i glu dbyangs nag po spyod pa'i zhabs kyi'o //
translated: The song of Malasi Goda is by the venerable Krsnacarya.

original: gang zhig yid kyi spyod yul mig 'phrul 'dra //
analyzed: gang zhig yid kyi spyod yul mig 'phrul 'dra //
translated: The object of mental activity is like a magical illusion.

original: lung dang po sti brdzun gyi phreng ba yin //
analyzed: lung dang po sti brdzun gyi phreng ba yin //
translated: The first scripture is a garland of lies.

original: ji ltar smra bas lhan skyes brjod par nus //
analyzed: ji ltar smra bas lhan skyes brjod par nus //
translated: How can the innate be expressed by speech?

original: lus ngag yid la gang du ma'i 'jug go //
analyzed: lus ngag yid la gang du ma'i 'jug go //
translated: It is engaged in body, speech, and mind.

original: bla mas brdzun gyi thabs kyis slob ma la //
analyzed: bla mas brdzun gyi thabs kyis slob ma la //
translated: The guru, by the method of lying, to the disciple,

original: ngag gi lam nas 'das pa ji ltar smra //
analyzed: ngag gi lam nas 'das pa ji ltar smra //
translated: How can one speak of what is beyond the path of speech?

original: gang de smra ba de dang de rnams brdzun //
analyzed: gang de smra ba de dang de rnams brdzun //
translated: Whatever is spoken, that is all lies.

original: bla ma'i thabs kyis slob ma 'khrul bar byas //
analyzed: bla ma'i thabs kyis slob ma 'khrul bar byas //
translated: The guru, by the method, confuses the disciple.

original: k'ahnas rgyal ba'i rin chen ji ltar smra //
analyzed: k'ahnas rgyal ba'i rin chen ji ltar smra //
translated: How can one speak of the jewel of the conqueror from KAH?

original: lkugs pas 'on par smra ba ji bzhin no //
analyzed: lkugs pas 'on par smra ba ji bzhin no //
translated: It is like a deaf person speaking of a mute.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' bas tshim pa'i nag po glu dbyangs zhabs rab tu dga' bas gsungs so //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' bas tshim pa'i nag po glu dbyangs zhabs rab tu dga' bas gsungs so //
translated: The song of Krsnacarya, satisfied by the joy of the innate, is spoken with great joy.

original: gang zhig yid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang yid dang dbang po'i spyod yul ni rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig yid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang yid dang dbang po'i spyod yul ni rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba'o //
translated: The line that which is the domain of mind and sense and so forth means that the domain of mind and sense is the net of thought and discursive thought.

original: lung dang sngags dang bstan bcos la sogs pa'i shes pa yang de thams cad kyang ngo //
analyzed: lung dang sngags dang bstan bcos la sogs pa'i shes pa yang de thams cad kyang ngo //
translated: The cognition of scripture, mantra, treatises, and so forth is also that.

original: de bzhin du yang lung dang rig byed rnying ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang lung dang rig byed rnying ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Similarly, the ancient Vedas and so forth.

original: dh'u'i rkang pas lhan cig skyes pa smra dka' ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dh'u'i rkang pas lhan cig skyes pa smra dka' ba gsungs te /
translated: The Dhutagunas speak of the difficulty of expressing the connate:

original: de'i phyir rig byed du ji ltar lhan cig skyes pa bla na med pa'i ye shes brjod par nus te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rig byed du ji ltar lhan cig skyes pa bla na med pa'i ye shes brjod par nus te /
translated: Therefore, how can the connate unsurpassed pristine consciousness be expressed in the Vedas?

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang yid lhan cig skyes pa gang la thim par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang yid lhan cig skyes pa gang la thim par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the connate body, voice, and mind of ordinary beings that dissolve into that.

original: de bzhin du ti lo ba'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du ti lo ba'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: Similarly, Tilopa's DohƒÅ says:

original: so so rang rig 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: so so rang rig 'bras bu ni //
translated: The result of one's own awareness

original: ti lo pa yis zhabs kyis smras //
analyzed: ti lo pa yis zhabs kyis smras //
translated: is expressed by the feet of Tilopa.

original: gang zhig yid kyi spyod yul sbas //
analyzed: gang zhig yid kyi spyod yul sbas //
translated: That which is hidden in the domain of the mind

original: de ni don dam ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni don dam ma yin no //
translated: is not the ultimate.

original: rkang pa gnyis pas de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin gsungs so //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pas de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin gsungs so //
translated: The second line states the nature of reality.

original: brdzun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bden pa ma yin pas bla mas slob ma la man ngag ster bar byed do //
analyzed: brdzun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bden pa ma yin pas bla mas slob ma la man ngag ster bar byed do //
translated: The line false and so on means that the teacher gives the disciple the instruction because it is not true.

original: @198a * // gang yang lhan cig skyes pa de rig byed ma yin pas so //
analyzed: @198a * // gang yang lhan cig skyes pa de rig byed ma yin pas so //
translated: And that which is innate is not a Vedic injunction.
